sentences.zh: 太史公曰：余每讀虞書，至於君臣相敕，維是几安，而股肱不良，萬事墮壞，未嘗不流涕也。

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: Every time I read the Books of Yu, when I reach the part about ministers advising each other to be vigilant and secure, while the limbs are not good and all affairs fall into ruin, I cannot help but shed tears.
translations.idiomatic: Sima Qian remarks: Whenever I read the Books of Yu, I am moved to tears by the passages where ministers exhort one another to maintain constant vigilance and security, only to see that when the ruler's closest advisors fail in their duties, all governance collapses into chaos.

sentences.zh: 成王作頌，推己懲艾，悲彼家難，可不謂戰戰恐懼，善守善終哉？

translations.literal: King Cheng made odes, extended his own punishments and regrets, grieved over the difficulties of his family, can this not be called trembling with fear, good at guarding and good at ending?
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng composed odes that extended his own self-reflection on past mistakes and sorrows, lamenting the misfortunes that befell his family—can this not be called a model of constant trepidation, diligent stewardship, and successful completion?

sentences.zh: 君子不為約則修德，滿則棄禮，佚能思初，安能惟始，沐浴膏澤而歌詠勤苦，非大德誰能如斯！

translations.literal: The gentleman, if not constrained, then cultivates virtue; if full, then abandons ritual. Leisure allows thinking of the beginning, security allows holding to the start. Bathed in rich favors while singing of toil and bitterness—who but one of great virtue could be like this!
translations.idiomatic: A noble person, when not constrained by hardship, cultivates moral character; when sated with success, abandons proper conduct. In times of leisure they reflect on humble beginnings; in security they hold fast to their origins. Even while basking in royal favor, they sing hymns to past struggles and hardships—who but one of supreme virtue could behave this way!

sentences.zh: 傳曰「治定功成，禮樂乃興」。

translations.literal: The tradition says: 'When governance is settled and achievements complete, then rites and music flourish.'
translations.idiomatic: As the old saying goes: 'Only when peace is established and great deeds accomplished do rites and music truly prosper.'

sentences.zh: 海內人道益深，其德益至，所樂者益異。

translations.literal: Within the seas, human morality grows deeper, their virtue grows more complete, and what they take pleasure in grows more refined.
translations.idiomatic: Throughout the realm, people grow more virtuous, their character more perfect, and their pleasures more elevated.

sentences.zh: 滿而不損則溢，盈而不持則傾。

translations.literal: If full but not diminished, it overflows; if replete but not maintained, it topples.
translations.idiomatic: Excess without restraint leads to spillage; abundance without support leads to collapse.

sentences.zh: 凡作樂者，所以節樂。

translations.literal: All music-making is for regulating joy.
translations.idiomatic: The purpose of creating music is to moderate pleasure.

sentences.zh: 君子以謙退為禮，以損減為樂，樂其如此也。

translations.literal: The gentleman takes modesty and yielding as ritual, takes reduction and subtraction as music, and takes pleasure in this being so.
translations.idiomatic: The noble person considers humility and deference to be proper conduct, regards moderation and restraint as true harmony, and finds contentment in such principles.

sentences.zh: 以為州異國殊，情習不同，故博采風俗，協比聲律，以補短移化，助流政教。

translations.literal: Considering that provinces differ and countries are distinct, feelings and customs vary, thus broadly collecting folkways, harmonizing and comparing tones and rhythms, to supplement deficiencies, shift and transform, assist the flow of governance and education.
translations.idiomatic: Recognizing that regions and nations differ, with diverse customs and habits, music draws widely from local traditions, coordinates scales and rhythms, fills in what's lacking, inspires cultural change, and supports the dissemination of moral teachings.

sentences.zh: 天子躬於明堂臨觀，而萬民咸蕩滌邪穢，斟酌飽滿，以飾厥性。

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven personally attends at the Bright Hall to observe, and the myriad people all wash away evil impurities, measured and full, to adorn their natures.
translations.idiomatic: When the emperor himself presides over ceremonies in the Hall of Light, all the people cleanse themselves of corruption, achieving perfect balance to refine their character.

sentences.zh: 故云雅頌之音理而民正，嘄噭之聲興而士奮，鄭衛之曲動而心淫。

translations.literal: Therefore it is said that the sounds of the ya and song genres bring order and the people are correct, the sounds of the sao and jiao genres arise and the scholars are aroused, the tunes of Zheng and Wei stir and the heart becomes licentious.
translations.idiomatic: Hence the saying: proper music from the royal courts brings moral order to the people; stirring melodies inspire scholars to action; while sensual tunes from Zheng and Wei arouse improper desires.

sentences.zh: 及其調和諧合，鳥獸盡感，而況懷五常，含好惡，自然之勢也？

translations.literal: When it reaches harmonious blending and concordant union, even birds and beasts are all moved, how much more so those who harbor the five constants, contain likes and dislikes—it is the natural tendency!
translations.idiomatic: When music achieves perfect harmony and unity, even birds and wild animals are stirred. How much more powerfully does it affect those who embody the cardinal virtues and harbor feelings of approval and disapproval? This is simply human nature.

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: I have often read the Yu Shu, reaching the point where ruler and minister mutually admonish, only then is the state secure, but if the limbs are not good, ten thousand affairs fall into ruin, I have never not shed tears. Cheng Wang made the Song, pushed himself to punish and reform, grieved those family difficulties, can it not be called trembling with fear, good at guarding and good at ending? The gentleman when not constrained then cultivates virtue, when full then abandons ritual, at ease can think of the beginning, secure can remember the start, bathed in rich favor while singing of hardship, who but great virtue can be like this! The tradition says 'When governance is settled and merit complete, ritual and music then flourish'. Within the seas human way grew deeper, their virtue grew more complete, what they took joy in grew more refined. Full without decrease then overflows, complete without holding then topples. All music making is to moderate joy. The gentleman takes humility and withdrawal as ritual, takes decrease and reduction as joy, takes joy in this way. Considering that provinces differ and states vary, feelings and customs differ, thus broadly gather customs, harmonize and compare tones and rhythms, to supplement shortcomings and shift transformation, assist flowing governance and teaching. The Son of Heaven personally at the Bright Hall observes, and the myriad people all wash away evil impurity, ladle full to the brim, to adorn their nature. Thus it is said the sounds of ya and song order and people are correct, the sounds of jiao jiao arise and scholars strive, the tunes of Zheng and Wei move and hearts become licentious. When it reaches harmonious blending, birds and beasts all are moved, and moreover those embracing the five constants, containing likes and dislikes, it is the natural tendency.

sentences.zh: 治道虧缺而鄭音興起，封君世辟，名顯鄰州，爭以相高。

translations.literal: The way of governance becomes deficient and the sounds of Zheng arise, feudal lords become hereditary nobles, fame becomes prominent in neighboring provinces, contending to surpass each other.
translations.idiomatic: When the principles of good government decline, decadent music from Zheng flourishes. Local lords establish hereditary fiefdoms, their reputations spreading to neighboring states as they compete for superiority.

sentences.zh: 自仲尼不能與齊優遂容於魯，雖退正樂以誘世，作五章以剌時，猶莫之化。

translations.literal: Since Confucius could not coexist with the Qi musicians in Lu, although he retired and corrected music to entice the age, composed five chapters to criticize the times, still none were transformed by it.
translations.idiomatic: Even Confucius himself could not remain in Lu alongside the musicians from Qi. Though he withdrew to reform music and inspire the world, composing five odes to condemn contemporary evils, still no one heeded his call.

sentences.zh: 陵遲以至六國，流沔沈佚，遂往不返，卒於喪身滅宗，并國於秦。

translations.literal: Declining gradually to the Six States, flowing and sinking into dissipation, going forth never to return, ending in losing life and destroying clans, merging states into Qin.
translations.idiomatic: This decline continued through the Warring States period, with moral decay spreading unchecked, leading inexorably to the ruin of individuals and families, until all kingdoms were absorbed by Qin.

translations.literal: When the way of governance is deficient and Zheng music arises, enfeoffed lords generation after generation become powerful, names illustrious in neighboring states, contend to surpass each other. Since Zhong Ni could not make the Qi actor tolerate him in Lu, though he retreated to correct music to guide the age, made five chapters to criticize the times, still none were transformed. Declining to reach the six states, flowing and sinking in dissipation, went away never to return, finally perished body and extinguished clan, united state to Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦二世尤以為娛。

translations.literal: Qin Second Generation especially took it as entertainment.
translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor of Qin was particularly fond of such diversions.

sentences.zh: 丞相李斯進諫曰：「放棄詩書，極意聲色，祖伊所以懼也；

translations.literal: Prime Minister Li Si advanced remonstrance saying: 'Abandoning the poems and documents, indulging in sounds and colors, this is what Ancestor Yi feared;
translations.idiomatic: Prime Minister Li Si offered this counsel: 'To discard the classics and indulge in music and women is exactly what terrified the ancient sage Yi.'

sentences.zh: 輕積細過，恣心長夜，紂所以亡也。」

translations.literal: lightly accumulating minor transgressions, indulging the heart through long nights, this is why Zhou perished.'
translations.idiomatic: 'To ignore small faults until they accumulate, and give free rein to desires through endless nights, was the downfall of the tyrant Zhou.'

sentences.zh: 趙高曰：「五帝、三王樂各殊名，示不相襲。

translations.literal: Zhao Gao said: 'The Five Emperors and Three Kings' music each had different names, showing they did not copy each other.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Gao replied: 'The music of the Five Emperors and Three Kings each bore unique names, demonstrating that none imitated their predecessors.'

sentences.zh: 上自朝廷，下至人民，得以接歡喜，合殷勤，非此和說不通，解澤不流，亦各一世之化，度時之樂，何必華山之騄耳而後行遠乎？」

translations.literal: From the court above to the people below, they can connect happiness, unite diligence, without this harmonious communication does not flow, beneficial moisture does not circulate, it is also each era's transformation, the pleasure appropriate to the time, why must it be the fine horse from Mount Hua that can travel far?
translations.idiomatic: 'From the imperial court to the common people, music brings joy and fosters harmony. Without it, understanding cannot be achieved and benevolence cannot spread. Each age develops its own culture and appropriate entertainments. Why insist on the finest steeds from Mount Hua to travel great distances?'

sentences.zh: 二世然之。

translations.literal: The Second Generation approved of this.
translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor agreed with this reasoning.

translations.literal: Qin Er Shi especially took it as entertainment. Chancellor Li Si advanced remonstrance saying: 'Abandon poetry and books, extreme in sounds and colors, Zu Yi thus feared; Lightly accumulate minor faults, indulge heart in long night, Zhou thus perished.' Zhao Gao said: 'The Five Emperors, Three Kings music each had different names, showing they did not imitate each other. Above from the court, below to the people, they can connect joy and happiness, unite attentiveness, not this harmonious delight does not communicate, the dissolving favor does not flow, also each age's transformation, measure of the times' joy, why must it be the Huashan black-eared horse then goes far?' Er Shi approved it.

sentences.zh: 高祖過沛詩三侯之章，令小兒歌之。

translations.literal: Gaozu passing through Pei recited the chapters about the Three Marquises, ordered children to sing them.
translations.idiomatic: When Gaozu passed through Pei, he recited verses about the Three Marquises and had the local children sing them.

sentences.zh: 高祖崩，令沛得以四時歌儛宗廟。

translations.literal: After Gaozu passed away, he ordered that Pei be allowed to sing and dance at the ancestral temples during the four seasons.
translations.idiomatic: Upon Gaozu's death, Pei was granted permission to perform seasonal songs and dances at the imperial ancestral shrines.

sentences.zh: 孝惠、孝文、孝景無所增更，於樂府習常肄舊而已。

translations.literal: Xiaohui, Xiaowen, Xiaojing made no additions or changes, at the Music Bureau they practiced the usual and rehearsed the old.
translations.idiomatic: Emperors Hui, Wen, and Jing made no innovations to the music. At the Imperial Music Bureau, they simply maintained the traditional repertoire and practices.

translations.literal: Gao Zu passed Pei sang the three marquess chapter, commanded children to sing it. Gao Zu collapsed, commanded Pei to use the four seasons to sing and dance at the ancestral temple. Xiao Hui, Xiao Wen, Xiao Jing made no additions or changes, at the Music Bureau practiced the constant and reviewed the old only.

sentences.zh: 至今上即位，作十九章，令侍中李延年次序其聲，拜為協律都尉。

translations.literal: Until the present emperor ascended the throne, composed nineteen chapters, ordered the attendant Li Yannian to arrange their melodies, appointed him as Colonel Who Harmonizes the Pitchpipes.
translations.idiomatic: When the current emperor took the throne, he composed nineteen songs. He commanded his attendant Li Yannian to arrange the music, and appointed him Colonel of Musical Harmony.

sentences.zh: 通一經之士不能獨知其辭，皆集會五經家，相與共講習讀之，乃能通知其意，多爾雅之文。

translations.literal: Scholars versed in a single classic cannot alone understand their lyrics, all gather the five classics scholars, together lecture and study and read them, then can thoroughly understand their meaning, much elegant and correct literature.
translations.idiomatic: Even scholars who have mastered a single classic cannot comprehend these lyrics alone. They must convene experts in all five classics to study and interpret them together before grasping their full meaning, which contains much refined and proper language.

translations.literal: Until the current emperor ascended the throne, made nineteen chapters, commanded Attendant Li Yan Nian to arrange their sounds, appointed as Harmonious Rhythms Colonel. Those who master one classic cannot alone know its words, all gather the five classics scholars, mutually discuss and practice read it, then can thoroughly understand its meaning, much elegant and correct writing.

sentences.zh: 漢家常以正月上辛祠太一甘泉，以昏時夜祠，到明而終。

translations.literal: The Han house constantly in the first month on the upper xin day sacrifices to Taiyi at Ganquan, with evening time night sacrifice, arriving at dawn and ending.
translations.idiomatic: The Han dynasty regularly performed sacrifices to Taiyi at Ganquan Palace on the first xin day of the first month. The ceremonies began at dusk and continued through the night until dawn.

sentences.zh: 常有流星經於祠壇上。

translations.literal: Constantly there were shooting stars passing over the sacrifice altar.
translations.idiomatic: Shooting stars regularly appeared, crossing above the sacrificial altar.

sentences.zh: 使僮男僮女七十人俱歌。

translations.literal: Made boy servants and girl servants seventy persons all sing together.
translations.idiomatic: Seventy young male and female attendants were assembled to sing in chorus.

sentences.zh: 春歌青陽，夏歌朱明，秋歌西暤，冬歌玄冥。

translations.literal: Spring sings Qingyang, summer sings Zhuming, autumn sings Xihan, winter sings Xuanming.
translations.idiomatic: In spring they sang of Azure Radiance, in summer of Vermilion Brilliance, in autumn of Western Brightness, in winter of Dark Mystery.

sentences.zh: 世多有，故不論。

translations.literal: The world has many such, therefore not discussed.
translations.idiomatic: Such examples abound in history, so they need not be detailed here.

translations.literal: Han house constantly in first month upper xin sacrifices Tai Yi at Gan Quan, with dusk time night sacrifice, arrives at dawn and ends. Constantly had shooting star pass over the sacrifice altar. Made boy servants and girl servants seventy people all sing together. Spring sings Qing Yang, summer sings Zhu Ming, autumn sings Xi Hai, winter sings Xuan Ming. The world has many such, thus not discussed.

sentences.zh: 又嘗得神馬渥洼水中，復次以為太一之歌。

translations.literal: Also once obtained a spirit horse in Wowo Pool water, again composed it as Taiyi's song.
translations.idiomatic: Once a divine horse was discovered in the waters of Wowo Pool, and another song was composed in honor of Taiyi.

sentences.zh: 歌曲曰：「太一貢兮天馬下，霑赤汗兮沫流赭。

translations.literal: The song says: 'Taiyi offers tribute, heavenly horse descends, moistens red sweat, froth flows crimson.
translations.idiomatic: The song went: 'Taiyi presents tribute, the heavenly horse comes down from above, its red sweat soaking through, frothy crimson flowing.'

sentences.zh: 騁容與兮跇萬里，今安匹兮龍為友。」

translations.literal: Gallops at ease, traverses ten thousand li, now what matches it, dragon is its companion.'
translations.idiomatic: 'It gallops freely, covering ten thousand li. What can rival it now? The dragon alone is its worthy companion.'

sentences.zh: 後伐大宛得千里馬，馬名蒲梢，次作以為歌。

translations.literal: Later attacked Dawan obtained thousand-li horse, horse named Pushao, next composed it as a song.
translations.idiomatic: Later, after conquering Dawan, they acquired a thousand-li horse named Pushao, and composed yet another song in its honor.

sentences.zh: 歌詩曰：「天馬來兮從西極，經萬里兮歸有德。

translations.literal: The song poem says: 'Heavenly horse comes from western extremity, traverses ten thousand li returns to one with virtue.
translations.idiomatic: The song proclaimed: 'The heavenly horse comes from the far western reaches, traveling ten thousand li to return to the virtuous ruler.'

sentences.zh: 承靈威兮降外國，涉流沙兮四夷服。」

translations.literal: Receives spiritual might, descends to foreign countries, crosses flowing sands, four barbarians submit.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Responding to divine power, it descends to distant lands, crosses the desert sands, bringing the four quarters under submission.'

sentences.zh: 中尉汲黯進曰：「凡王者作樂，上以承祖宗，下以化兆民。

translations.literal: Commandant Ji An advanced saying: 'All kings who make music, above to receive ancestors, below to transform the myriad people.
translations.idiomatic: Commandant Ji An stepped forward and said: 'When sovereigns create music, it honors their ancestors above and civilizes the people below.'

sentences.zh: 今陛下得馬，詩以為歌，協於宗廟，先帝百姓豈能知其音邪？」

translations.literal: Now Your Majesty obtains horse, makes poem into song, harmonizes at ancestral temple, former emperors and people how can they know its sound?'
translations.idiomatic: 'Now that Your Majesty has acquired this horse and composed a song about it to be performed in the ancestral temples—how will the former emperors and the common people ever hear or understand such music?'

sentences.zh: 上默然不說。

translations.literal: The emperor was silently displeased.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor fell silent, clearly displeased.

sentences.zh: 丞相公孫弘曰：「黯誹謗聖制，當族。」

translations.literal: Prime Minister Gongsun Hong said: 'An slanders and defames the sage's system, should be exterminated along with his clan.'
translations.idiomatic: Prime Minister Gongsun Hong declared: 'An dares to slander and criticize the emperor's wise policies. He and his entire clan should be executed.'

translations.literal: Also once obtained divine horse in Wo Wo water, moreover arranged it as Tai Yi song. Song lyrics say: 'Tai Yi sends down the heavenly horse, moistens red sweat flows foam crimson. Gallops at ease crosses ten thousand li, now has companion dragon as friend.' Later attacked Da Yuan obtained thousand li horse, horse named Pu Shao, moreover made it as song. Song poem says: 'Heavenly horse comes from western extreme, crosses ten thousand li returns to virtuous. Receives spiritual might descends foreign lands, crosses flowing sands four barbarians submit.' Colonel Ji Pian advanced saying: 'All kings who make music, above to receive ancestors, below to transform the myriad people. Now Your Majesty obtains horse, makes poem as song, harmonizes at ancestral temple, former emperors and people how can they know its sound?' The emperor was silent not pleased. Chancellor Gong Sun Hong said: 'Pian slanders the sacred system, should be exterminated.'

sentences.zh: 凡音之起，由人心生也。

translations.literal: All sound's arising comes from the human heart being born.
translations.idiomatic: All music originates from the human heart.

sentences.zh: 人心之動，物使之然也。

translations.literal: The human heart's movement, things cause it to be so.
translations.idiomatic: The emotions of the human heart are stirred by external things.

sentences.zh: 感於物而動，故形於聲；

translations.literal: Moved by things and thus moves, therefore takes form in sound;
translations.idiomatic: When stimulated by external objects, emotions manifest as sound.

sentences.zh: 聲相應，故生變；

translations.literal: Sounds respond to each other, therefore produce change;
translations.idiomatic: When sounds interact, they create variations.

sentences.zh: 變成方，謂之音；

translations.literal: Change forms into patterns, called sound;
translations.idiomatic: When these variations coalesce into regular patterns, we call it music.

sentences.zh: 比音而樂之，及干戚羽旄，謂之樂也。

translations.literal: Compare sounds and take pleasure in them, and shields spears feathers banners, called music.
translations.idiomatic: When sounds are arranged and performed with instruments like spears, shields, feathers, and banners, this is called music.

sentences.zh: 樂者，音之所由生也，其本在人心感於物也。

translations.literal: Music is what sound is born from, its root is in the human heart being moved by things.
translations.idiomatic: Music is the result of organized sound, and its foundation lies in the human heart being moved by external stimuli.

sentences.zh: 是故其哀心感者，其聲噍以殺；

translations.literal: Therefore those whose sorrowful heart is moved, their sound is clear and subdued;
translations.idiomatic: Thus, when a sorrowful heart is stirred, the resulting sound is clear but restrained.

sentences.zh: 其樂心感者，其聲啴以緩；

translations.literal: those whose joyful heart is moved, their sound is expansive and slow;
translations.idiomatic: When a joyful heart is moved, the sound becomes expansive and leisurely.

sentences.zh: 其喜心感者，其聲發以散；

translations.literal: those whose happy heart is moved, their sound is released and dispersed;
translations.idiomatic: When happiness fills the heart, the sound bursts forth freely.

sentences.zh: 其怒心感者，其聲麤以厲；

translations.literal: those whose angry heart is moved, their sound is coarse and harsh;
translations.idiomatic: When anger stirs within, the sound grows rough and severe.

sentences.zh: 其敬心感者，其聲直以廉；

translations.literal: those whose respectful heart is moved, their sound is straight and upright;
translations.idiomatic: When reverence moves the heart, the sound becomes direct and principled.

sentences.zh: 其愛心感者，其聲和以柔。

translations.literal: those whose loving heart is moved, their sound is harmonious and gentle;
translations.idiomatic: When love stirs within, the sound becomes harmonious and tender.

sentences.zh: 六者非性也，感於物而後動，是故先王慎所以感之。

translations.literal: These six are not innate nature, they are moved only after being stimulated by things, therefore the former kings were careful about what stimulated them.
translations.idiomatic: These six emotions are not inborn traits; they arise only when stimulated by external things. This is why the ancient kings were cautious about what could arouse them.

sentences.zh: 故禮以導其志，樂以和其聲，政以壹其行，刑以防其姦。

translations.literal: Therefore ritual guides their intentions, music harmonizes their sounds, governance unifies their conduct, punishment prevents their wickedness.
translations.idiomatic: Thus, ritual guides their aspirations, music harmonizes their expressions, government unites their actions, and law prevents their corruption.

sentences.zh: 禮樂刑政，其極一也，所以同民心而出治道也。

translations.literal: Ritual, music, punishment, and governance, their ultimate aim is one, to unify the people's hearts and bring forth the way of governance.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual, music, law, and administration all share the same ultimate purpose: to unite the people's hearts and establish proper governance.

translations.literal: All sound arises from the human heart. The human heart's movement, things cause it so. Moved by things thus takes form in sound; Sounds respond thus give rise to change; Change becomes pattern, called sound; Compare sounds and take joy in them, and with shields axes feathers banners, called music. Music is that from which sound is born, its root is in the human heart moved by things. Thus those whose sorrowful heart is moved, their sound is high and sharp; Those whose joyful heart is moved, their sound smooth slow; Those whose happy heart is moved, their sound issue scatter; Those whose angry heart is moved, their sound coarse fierce; Those whose respectful heart is moved, their sound straight pure; Those whose loving heart is moved, their sound harmonious soft. Six not nature, moved by things then act, thus former kings careful what move them. Thus ritual to guide their will, music to harmonize their sound, governance to unify their conduct, punishment to guard their evil. Ritual music punishment governance, their extreme one, thus same people's hearts and issue governance way.

sentences.zh: 凡音者，生人心者也。

translations.literal: All sound is that which is born from the human heart.
translations.idiomatic: All musical sound originates from the human heart.

sentences.zh: 情動於中，故形於聲，聲成文謂之音。

translations.literal: Emotions move within, therefore take form in sound, when sound forms patterns it is called music.
translations.idiomatic: Emotions stir within and manifest as sound. When sound takes on regular patterns, we call it music.

sentences.zh: 是故治世之音安以樂，其正和；

translations.literal: Therefore the sounds of a well-ordered age are peaceful and joyful, their correct tone harmonious;
translations.idiomatic: Thus, the music of a well-governed era is peaceful and joyful, properly balanced.

sentences.zh: 亂世之音怨以怒，其正乖；

translations.literal: the sounds of a chaotic age are resentful and angry, their correct tone discordant;
translations.idiomatic: The music of a turbulent era is resentful and angry, improperly discordant.

sentences.zh: 亡國之音哀以思，其民困。

translations.literal: the sounds of a perishing state are sorrowful and longing, its people distressed.
translations.idiomatic: The music of a doomed nation is mournful and yearning, its people suffering.

sentences.zh: 聲音之道，與正通矣。

translations.literal: The way of sound and music connects with righteousness.
translations.idiomatic: The principles of music are intimately connected with moral order.

sentences.zh: 宮為君，商為臣，角為民，徵為事，羽為物。

translations.literal: Palace is ruler, merchant is minister, horn is people, zhi is affairs, feather is things.
translations.idiomatic: The gong mode represents the ruler, shang the ministers, jiao the people, zhi the affairs of state, yu material things.

sentences.zh: 五者不亂，則無惉懘之音矣。

translations.literal: If the five are not disordered, then there are no sounds of resentment and distress.
translations.idiomatic: When these five elements remain in proper balance, there will be no music expressing resentment or anxiety.

sentences.zh: 宮亂則荒，其君驕；

translations.literal: If palace is disordered then wild, its ruler arrogant;
translations.idiomatic: When the gong mode is disrupted, it becomes wild—the ruler grows arrogant.

sentences.zh: 商亂則搥，其臣壞；

translations.literal: if merchant is disordered then violent, its ministers corrupt;
translations.idiomatic: When the shang mode is disrupted, it becomes violent—the ministers become corrupt.

sentences.zh: 角亂則憂，其民怨；

translations.literal: if horn is disordered then anxious, its people resentful;
translations.idiomatic: When the jiao mode is disrupted, it becomes anxious—the people grow resentful.

sentences.zh: 徵亂則哀，其事勤；

translations.literal: if zhi is disordered then sorrowful, its affairs laborious;
translations.idiomatic: When the zhi mode is disrupted, it becomes sorrowful—state affairs grow burdensome.

sentences.zh: 羽亂則危，其財匱。

translations.literal: if feather is disordered then dangerous, its wealth depleted.
translations.idiomatic: When the yu mode is disrupted, it becomes dangerous—resources run scarce.

sentences.zh: 五者皆亂，迭相陵，謂之慢。

translations.literal: If all five are disordered, mutually encroaching, it is called insolence.
translations.idiomatic: When all five modes are disrupted and encroach upon each other, this is called licentiousness.

sentences.zh: 如此則國之滅亡無日矣。

translations.literal: In this way then the state's destruction has no date.
translations.idiomatic: In such circumstances, the nation's collapse is imminent.

sentences.zh: 鄭衛之音，亂世之音也，比於慢矣。

translations.literal: The sounds of Zheng and Wei are the sounds of a chaotic age, comparable to insolence.
translations.idiomatic: The music of Zheng and Wei represents the decadent sounds of turbulent times, bordering on outright licentiousness.

sentences.zh: 桑閒濮上之音，亡國之音也，其政散，其民流，誣上行私而不可止。

translations.literal: The sounds of Sangjian and Puyang are the sounds of a perishing state, its governance scattered, its people drifting, deceiving superiors and practicing selfishness without being able to stop.
translations.idiomatic: The music of Sangjian and Puyang heralds a nation's doom: government collapses, people become refugees, officials deceive their superiors and pursue private interests unchecked.

translations.literal: All sound, born human heart. Feelings move within, thus form in sound, sound forms pattern called sound. Thus orderly age sound peaceful joyful, its correct harmony; Chaotic age sound resentful angry, its correct contrary; Perished state sound sorrowful thoughtful, its people distressed. Sound way, with correct connects. Gong for ruler, shang for minister, jue for people, zhi for affairs, yu for things. Five not chaotic, then no worried sounds. Gong chaotic then wild, its ruler arrogant; Shang chaotic then strike, its ministers ruined; Jue chaotic then worry, its people resentful; Zhi chaotic then sorrow, its affairs diligent; Yu chaotic then dangerous, its wealth scarce. Five all chaotic, mutually invade, called slow. Thus then state's extinction no day. Zheng Wei sounds, chaotic age sounds, close to slow. Sang Jian Pu Shang sounds, perished state sounds, its governance scattered, its people flow, deceive superiors carry private cannot stop.

sentences.zh: 凡音者，生於人心者也；

translations.literal: All sound is that which is born from the human heart;
translations.idiomatic: All musical sound originates from the human heart.

sentences.zh: 樂者，通於倫理者也。

translations.literal: music is that which connects to human relationships and principles.
translations.idiomatic: Music connects with the principles of human relationships.

sentences.zh: 是故知聲而不知音者，禽獸是也；

translations.literal: Therefore those who know sound but not music are birds and beasts;
translations.idiomatic: Thus, those who understand mere sound but not organized music are like animals.

sentences.zh: 知音而不知樂者，眾庶是也。

translations.literal: those who know music but not harmony are the common people.
translations.idiomatic: Those who understand musical patterns but not the deeper harmony are ordinary folk.

sentences.zh: 唯君子為能知樂。

translations.literal: Only the gentleman is able to understand harmony.
translations.idiomatic: Only the noble person can truly comprehend music's deeper meaning.

sentences.zh: 是故審聲以知音，審音以知樂，審樂以知政，而治道備矣。

translations.literal: Therefore examine sound to know music, examine music to know harmony, examine harmony to know governance, and the way of governance is complete.
translations.idiomatic: Thus, by analyzing sound one understands music; by analyzing music one understands harmony; by analyzing harmony one understands governance—and the principles of good government are complete.

sentences.zh: 是故不知聲者不可與言音，不知音者不可與言樂知樂則幾於禮矣。

translations.literal: Therefore those who do not know sound cannot discuss music with them, those who do not know music cannot discuss harmony with them. Knowing harmony then approaches ritual.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, one cannot discuss music with someone who doesn't understand sound, nor harmony with someone who doesn't understand music. But understanding harmony brings one close to comprehending ritual.

sentences.zh: 禮樂皆得，謂之有德。

translations.literal: Ritual and music both obtained, called having virtue.
translations.idiomatic: Mastering both ritual and music is called possessing true virtue.

sentences.zh: 德者得也。

translations.literal: Virtue means obtaining.
translations.idiomatic: Virtue means having attained the proper way.

sentences.zh: 是故樂之隆，非極音也；

translations.literal: Therefore music's flourishing is not the extreme of sound;
translations.idiomatic: Thus, music's grandeur does not lie in pushing sound to its limits.

sentences.zh: 食饗之禮，非極味也。

translations.literal: the ritual of feasting is not the extreme of flavor.
translations.idiomatic: Nor does the ritual of grand banquets lie in pursuing the most exquisite tastes.

sentences.zh: 清廟之瑟，朱弦而疏越，一倡而三嘆，有遺音者矣。

translations.literal: The zither of the Pure Temple, with vermilion strings and sparse bridges, one begins and three sigh, there are lingering sounds.
translations.idiomatic: The zithers in the ancestral temples have crimson strings and widely spaced bridges. One performer begins, and three respond with sighs—such music leaves a haunting resonance.

sentences.zh: 大饗之禮，尚玄酒而俎腥魚，大羹不和，有遺味者矣。

translations.literal: The ritual of great feasting honors clear wine and platters of raw fish, great broth unseasoned, there are lingering flavors.
translations.idiomatic: In the grandest banquets, clear water is valued over wine, raw fish over delicacies, and plain broth over rich stews—such simplicity leaves a profound aftertaste.

sentences.zh: 是故先王之制禮樂也，非以極口腹耳目之欲也，將以教民平好惡而反人道之正也。

translations.literal: Therefore the former kings' establishment of ritual and music was not to indulge the desires of mouth and belly, ears and eyes, but to teach the people to balance likes and dislikes and return to the correctness of human morality.
translations.idiomatic: This is why the ancient kings established ritual and music—not to satisfy sensual appetites, but to teach people to maintain balance in their preferences and return to the proper path of human conduct.

translations.literal: All sound, born human heart; Music, connects principles ethics. Thus know sound not know sound, birds beasts are; Know sound not know music, common people are. Only gentleman can know music. Thus examine sound to know sound, examine sound to know music, examine music to know governance, governance way complete. Thus not know sound cannot speak sound with, not know sound cannot speak music know music then near ritual. Ritual music all obtained, called has virtue. Virtue is obtain. Thus music's flourishing, not extreme sound; Feast ritual, not extreme flavor. Clear temple qin, vermilion strings sparse bridges, one lead three sigh, has remaining sound. Great feast ritual, still black wine zu raw fish, great broth not mixed, has remaining flavor. Thus former kings' establish ritual music, not to extreme mouth belly ears eyes desires, will teach people even likes dislikes return human way correct.

sentences.zh: 人生而靜，天之性也；

translations.literal: Human nature at birth is tranquil, it is heaven's nature;
translations.idiomatic: Humans are born in a state of natural calm—this is their heavenly endowment.

sentences.zh: 感於物而動，性之頌也。

translations.literal: moved by things and thus moves, it is nature's endowment.
translations.idiomatic: Being stirred by external stimuli and responding is part of human nature.

sentences.zh: 物至知知，然後好惡形焉。

translations.literal: Things arrive and knowledge knows, then likes and dislikes take form.
translations.idiomatic: When external stimuli reach us, awareness perceives them, and only then do preferences and aversions manifest.

sentences.zh: 好惡無節於內，知誘於外，不能反己，天理滅矣。

translations.literal: Likes and dislikes without moderation within, knowledge seduced from outside, cannot return to oneself, heavenly principle is extinguished.
translations.idiomatic: When inner preferences lack restraint and outer temptations seduce the mind, one cannot reflect inwardly—natural morality is lost.

sentences.zh: 夫物之感人無窮，而人之好惡無節，則是物至而人化物也。

translations.literal: Now things' stimulation of people is endless, and if people's likes and dislikes have no moderation, then things arrive and people are transformed by things.
translations.idiomatic: External stimuli affect us endlessly. Without moderation in our desires, we become shaped by these external forces rather than shaping them.

sentences.zh: 人化物也者，滅天理而窮人欲者也。

translations.literal: People being transformed by things is extinguishing heavenly principle and exhausting human desires.
translations.idiomatic: When external things control us, we destroy natural morality and exhaust ourselves in selfish pursuits.

sentences.zh: 於是有悖逆詐偽之心，有淫佚作亂之事。

translations.literal: Then there are rebellious and deceitful hearts, there are licentious and disorderly affairs.
translations.idiomatic: This gives rise to rebellious thoughts and deceitful minds, licentious behavior and acts of rebellion.

sentences.zh: 是故彊者脅弱，眾者暴寡，知者詐愚，勇者苦怯，疾病不養，老幼孤寡不得其所，此大亂之道也。

translations.literal: Therefore the strong coerce the weak, the many tyrannize the few, the knowledgeable deceive the ignorant, the brave torment the cowardly, the sick and diseased are not cared for, the old, young, orphaned, and widowed do not get their proper place—this is the way of great disorder.
translations.idiomatic: Thus the powerful bully the weak, the many oppress the few, the clever exploit the simple, the brave torment the timid. The sick go unattended, the elderly, children, orphans, and widows find no proper place—this is the path to utter chaos.

sentences.zh: 是故先王制禮樂，人為之節：衰麻哭泣，所以節喪紀也；

translations.literal: Therefore the former kings established ritual and music, making sections for people: mourning garments and weeping, to moderate mourning observances;
translations.idiomatic: This is why the ancient kings established ritual and music to provide human life with structure: mourning clothes and weeping moderate the rites of bereavement.

sentences.zh: 鐘鼓干戚，所以和安樂也；

translations.literal: bells and drums, shields and axes, to harmonize peace and joy;
translations.idiomatic: Bells, drums, shields, and battle-axes harmonize celebrations of peace and happiness.

sentences.zh: 婚姻冠笄，所以別男女也；

translations.literal: marriage and capping ceremonies, to distinguish males and females;
translations.idiomatic: Marriage ceremonies and coming-of-age rites establish distinctions between men and women.

sentences.zh: 射鄉食饗，所以正交接也。

translations.literal: archery contests and village feasts, to correct social interactions.
translations.idiomatic: Archery competitions and communal banquets regulate social relationships.

sentences.zh: 禮節民心，樂和民聲，政以行之，刑以防之。

translations.literal: Ritual moderates the people's hearts, music harmonizes the people's voices, governance carries it out, punishment prevents it.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual disciplines the people's minds, music harmonizes their expressions, government implements these principles, and law prevents violations.

sentences.zh: 禮樂刑政四達而不悖，則王道備矣。

translations.literal: Ritual, music, punishment, and governance reach everywhere without contradiction, then the kingly way is complete.
translations.idiomatic: When ritual, music, law, and administration permeate society without conflict, the way of the true sovereign is fully realized.

translations.literal: Human life quiet, heaven's nature; Moved by things act, nature's endowment. Things arrive know know, then likes dislikes form. Likes dislikes no measure within, knowledge lured without, cannot return self, heaven principle extinguished. Things move people infinite, human likes dislikes no measure, then things arrive human transform things. Human transform things, extinguish heaven principle exhaust human desires. Thus have contrary deceit false heart, have licentious dissipation make chaos affairs. Thus strong coerce weak, many violent few, wise deceive foolish, brave oppress cowardly, sickness not nurture, old young orphans widows not get place, this great chaos way. Thus former kings establish ritual music, human make measure: mourning hemp cry weep, thus measure mourning record; Bells drums shield axe, thus harmonize peaceful joy; Marriage capping and hair-pinning, thus to distinguish male and female; Archery village feasts, thus to correct intercourse. Ritual moderates the people's hearts, music harmonizes the people's sounds, governance to carry it out, punishment to guard against it. Ritual music punishment governance four reach without contradiction, then the kingly way is complete.

sentences.zh: 樂者為同，禮者為異。

translations.literal: Music is for unity, ritual is for distinction.
translations.idiomatic: Music creates harmony and unity, while ritual establishes necessary distinctions.

sentences.zh: 同則相親，異則相敬。

translations.literal: Unity brings mutual affection, difference brings mutual respect.
translations.idiomatic: Like-minded people draw close; those who differ show respect.

sentences.zh: 樂勝則流，禮勝則離。

translations.literal: If music prevails, it flows away; if ritual prevails, it separates.
translations.idiomatic: Too much emphasis on music leads to dissipation; too much on ritual creates alienation.

sentences.zh: 合情飾貌者，禮樂之事也。

translations.literal: Uniting feelings and adorning appearances is the matter of ritual and music.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual and music harmonize inner emotions with outward decorum.

sentences.zh: 禮義立，則貴賤等矣；

translations.literal: When ritual and righteousness are established, then noble and base are equal;
translations.idiomatic: When ritual and moral principles are upheld, social hierarchies become equitable.

sentences.zh: 樂文同，則上下和矣；

translations.literal: when music's patterns are unified, then superiors and inferiors are harmonious;
translations.idiomatic: When musical forms are shared, harmony prevails between high and low.

sentences.zh: 好惡著，則賢不肖別矣；

translations.literal: when likes and dislikes are manifest, then worthy and unworthy are distinguished;
translations.idiomatic: When preferences are clear, the capable and incapable are differentiated.

sentences.zh: 刑禁暴，爵舉賢，則政均矣。

translations.literal: punishment restrains violence, titles elevate the worthy, then governance is balanced.
translations.idiomatic: Law curbs the violent, honors reward the able, and administration becomes fair.

sentences.zh: 仁以愛之，義以正之，如此則民治行矣。

translations.literal: Benevolence loves them, righteousness corrects them, in this way then civil governance proceeds.
translations.idiomatic: Humaneness shows them compassion, righteousness keeps them on course—and thus good government advances.

translations.literal: Music is for sameness, ritual is for difference. Same then mutually intimate, different then mutually respectful. Music prevails then flows, ritual prevails then separates. Uniting feelings adorning appearance, is ritual music's affair. Ritual righteousness established, then noble base equal; Music culture same, then high low harmonize; Likes dislikes manifest, then worthy unworthy distinguished; Punishment prohibits violence, rank raises worthy, then governance even. Benevolence to love them, righteousness to correct them, thus then people governance flows.

sentences.zh: 樂由中出，禮自外作。

translations.literal: Music emerges from within, ritual is made from without.
translations.idiomatic: Music springs from inner feelings; ritual derives from external forms.

sentences.zh: 樂由中出，故靜；

translations.literal: Music emerges from within, therefore tranquil;
translations.idiomatic: Since music comes from within, it remains serene.

sentences.zh: 禮自外作，故文。

translations.literal: ritual is made from without, therefore patterned.
translations.idiomatic: Since ritual comes from without, it is elaborately structured.

sentences.zh: 大樂必易，大禮必簡。

translations.literal: Great music must be simple, great ritual must be plain.
translations.idiomatic: True music achieves greatness through simplicity; true ritual through austerity.

sentences.zh: 樂至則無怨，禮至則不爭。

translations.literal: When music reaches its peak, there is no resentment; when ritual reaches its peak, there is no contention.
translations.idiomatic: Perfect music eliminates grievances; perfect ritual prevents disputes.

sentences.zh: 揖讓而治天下者，禮樂之謂也。

translations.literal: Those who govern the world through yielding and deference are what ritual and music mean.
translations.idiomatic: To rule the world through courtesy and mutual respect—this embodies ritual and music.

sentences.zh: 暴民不作，諸侯賓服，兵革不試，五刑不用，百姓無患，天子不怒，如此則樂達矣。

translations.literal: Rebellious people do not arise, feudal lords submit as guests, weapons are not tested, the five punishments are not used, the common people have no troubles, the Son of Heaven has no anger, in this way then music reaches its fulfillment.
translations.idiomatic: When no rebels appear, when lords pay homage, when arms remain unused, when punishments go unenforced, when people live without fear, when the emperor knows no wrath—then music has achieved its perfect expression.

sentences.zh: 合父子之親，明長幼之序，以敬四海之內。

translations.literal: Unite the affection between father and son, clarify the order between elder and younger, to show respect within the four seas.
translations.idiomatic: It unites parental and filial bonds, establishes the hierarchy of age, and commands reverence throughout the realm.

sentences.zh: 天子如此，則禮行矣。

translations.literal: When the Son of Heaven is like this, then ritual proceeds.
translations.idiomatic: When the emperor embodies these principles, ritual finds its true implementation.

translations.literal: Music comes from within, ritual is made from without. Music comes from within, thus quiet; Ritual made from without, thus patterned. Great music must be easy, great ritual must be simple. Music reaches then no resentment, ritual reaches then no contention. Yielding and deferring to govern the world, this is called ritual music. Violent people do not arise, feudal lords submit as guests, weapons not tested, five punishments not used, hundred families without worry, Son of Heaven not angry, thus then music reaches completion. Unites father son closeness, clarifies elder younger order, to respect within the four seas. Son of Heaven thus, then ritual flows.

sentences.zh: 大樂與天地同和，大禮與天地同節。

translations.literal: Great music shares harmony with heaven and earth, great ritual shares measure with heaven and earth.
translations.idiomatic: Supreme music harmonizes with the cosmos; supreme ritual aligns with cosmic order.

sentences.zh: 和，故百物不失；

translations.literal: Harmony, therefore the hundred things do not go astray;
translations.idiomatic: Through harmony, all things remain true to their nature.

sentences.zh: 節，故祀天祭地。

translations.literal: measure, therefore sacrifice to heaven and offer to earth.
translations.idiomatic: Through proper measure, we honor heaven and earth with sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 明則有禮樂，幽則有鬼神，如此則四海之內合敬同愛矣。

translations.literal: In the visible there are ritual and music, in the hidden there are spirits and gods, in this way then within the four seas they unite in respect and share love.
translations.idiomatic: In the seen world there is ritual and music; in the unseen, spirits and deities. Thus throughout the realm, all unite in reverence and mutual affection.

sentences.zh: 禮者，殊事合敬者也；

translations.literal: Ritual is that which distinguishes affairs and unites respect;
translations.idiomatic: Ritual distinguishes various matters while uniting all in respect.

sentences.zh: 樂者，異文合愛者也。

translations.literal: music is that which varies patterns and unites love.
translations.idiomatic: Music varies its forms while uniting all in affection.

sentences.zh: 禮樂之情同，故明王以相沿也。

translations.literal: The inner nature of ritual and music is the same, therefore enlightened kings have handed them down to each other.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual and music share the same essential spirit, which is why enlightened rulers have preserved them through the ages.

sentences.zh: 故事與時并，名與功偕。

translations.literal: Therefore affairs accompany time, names accompany achievements.
translations.idiomatic: Thus institutions evolve with the times, and reputations match accomplishments.

sentences.zh: 故鐘鼓管磬羽籥干戚，樂之器也；

translations.literal: Therefore bells and drums, pipes and chimes, feather flutes and shield-axes are music's instruments;
translations.idiomatic: Thus bells, drums, reed pipes, stone chimes, feather flutes, and ceremonial weapons are the instruments of music.

sentences.zh: 詘信俯仰級兆舒疾，樂之文也。

translations.literal: bending and straightening, bowing and raising, steps and positions, slow and fast, are music's patterns.
translations.idiomatic: The bending, stretching, bowing, rising, steps, positions, pacing, and tempo—these form music's choreography.

sentences.zh: 簠簋俎豆制度文章，禮之器也；

translations.literal: Gui and fu vessels, zu and dou stands, systems and patterns are ritual's instruments;
translations.idiomatic: The ritual vessels—gui, fu, zu, dou—with their established forms and decorations, are the instruments of ceremony.

sentences.zh: 升降上下周旋裼襲，禮之文也。

translations.literal: ascending and descending, high and low, circling and turning, baring and covering, are ritual's patterns.
translations.idiomatic: The movements of rising, descending, circling, turning, and the ritual gestures of exposure and covering—these constitute ritual's formal choreography.

sentences.zh: 故知禮樂之情者能作，識禮樂之文者能術。

translations.literal: Therefore those who know the inner nature of ritual and music can create, those who recognize the patterns of ritual and music can perform.
translations.idiomatic: Thus, those who understand the essence of ritual and music can create them; those who master their forms can execute them skillfully.

sentences.zh: 作者之謂聖，術者之謂明。

translations.literal: Creators are called sages, performers are called enlightened.
translations.idiomatic: Those who create are called sages; those who master technique are called enlightened.

sentences.zh: 明聖者，術作之謂也。

translations.literal: Enlightened sages are those who combine technique and creation.
translations.idiomatic: The truly enlightened sages combine both creative vision and technical mastery.

translations.literal: Great music with heaven earth same harmony, great ritual with heaven earth same measure. Harmony, thus hundred things not lost; Measure, thus sacrifice heaven worship earth. Bright then has ritual music, dark then has ghosts spirits, thus within four seas united respect same love. Ritual is different affairs united respect; Music is different patterns united love. Ritual music feelings same, thus enlightened kings mutually continue. Thus affairs with time together, name with merit accompany. Thus bells drums pipes chimes feathers yu shields axes, music's instruments; Bend stretch bow rise levels ranks spread hurry, music's patterns. Gui fu zu dou systems patterns, ritual's instruments; Ascend descend high low circle turn bare wear, ritual's patterns. Thus knowing ritual music feelings can create, recognizing ritual music patterns can explain. Creator called sage, explainer called enlightened. Enlightened sage is explainer creator called.

sentences.zh: 樂者，天地之和也；

translations.literal: Music is the harmony of heaven and earth;
translations.idiomatic: Music embodies the harmony of heaven and earth.

sentences.zh: 禮者，天地之序也。

translations.literal: ritual is the order of heaven and earth.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual reflects the order of heaven and earth.

sentences.zh: 和，故百物皆化；

translations.literal: Harmony, therefore all things are transformed;
translations.idiomatic: Through harmony, all things find their proper form.

sentences.zh: 序，故群物皆別。

translations.literal: order, therefore all things are distinguished.
translations.idiomatic: Through order, all things maintain their distinctions.

sentences.zh: 樂由天作，禮以地制。

translations.literal: Music is made by heaven, ritual is formulated by earth.
translations.idiomatic: Music derives its inspiration from heaven; ritual takes its form from earth.

sentences.zh: 過制則亂，過作則暴。

translations.literal: Exceeding formulation leads to disorder, exceeding creation leads to tyranny.
translations.idiomatic: Overly rigid forms breed chaos; excessive creativity breeds violence.

sentences.zh: 明於天地，然後能興禮樂也。

translations.literal: Understanding heaven and earth, then one can promote ritual and music.
translations.idiomatic: Only those who comprehend the cosmos can properly establish ritual and music.

sentences.zh: 論倫無患，樂之情也；

translations.literal: Discussing relationships without trouble, is music's inner nature;
translations.idiomatic: To discuss human relationships without conflict embodies music's true spirit.

sentences.zh: 欣喜驩愛，樂之（容）［官］也。

translations.literal: Joyful happiness and loving affection, are music's appearance.
translations.idiomatic: Joyful delight and loving affection manifest as music's outward expression.

sentences.zh: 中正無邪，禮之質也；

translations.literal: Central and upright without deviation, is ritual's substance;
translations.idiomatic: Balance and rectitude without corruption form ritual's essential character.

sentences.zh: 莊敬恭順，禮之制也。

translations.literal: Solemn respect and humble obedience, are ritual's formulation.
translations.idiomatic: Dignity, reverence, modesty, and deference constitute ritual's proper structure.

sentences.zh: 若夫禮樂之施於金石，越於聲音，用於宗廟社稷，事于山川鬼神，則此所以與民同也。

translations.literal: As for ritual and music's application to metal and stone, transcending sounds and tones, used in ancestral temples and altars of soil and grain, serving mountains and rivers, spirits and gods, then this is what unites with the people.
translations.idiomatic: When ritual and music are performed with bells and chimes, surpassing mere sound to become something transcendent, when they serve ancestral shrines and the altars of state, when they honor mountains, rivers, and deities—then they unite ruler and people.

translations.literal: Music is heaven earth's harmony; Ritual is heaven earth's order. Harmony thus hundred things all transform; Order thus group things all distinguished. Music by heaven made, ritual by earth formed. Exceed formation then chaos, exceed making then violent. Clear about heaven earth, then can flourish ritual music. Discuss principles without worry, music's feeling; Joy happiness delight love, music's appearance. Central correct without evil, ritual's substance; Solemn respectful reverent yielding, ritual's system. As for ritual music's application to metal stone, surpasses sounds, used at ancestral temple earth altar, serves mountain rivers ghosts spirits, then this is to unite with people.

sentences.zh: 王者功成作樂，治定制禮。

translations.literal: Kings when achievements are complete make music, when governance is settled establish ritual.
translations.idiomatic: Sovereigns create music upon completing great deeds; they establish ritual when peace is achieved.

sentences.zh: 其功大者其樂備，其治辨者其禮具。

translations.literal: Those whose achievements are great have complete music, those whose governance is clear have complete ritual.
translations.idiomatic: The greater the accomplishments, the more comprehensive the music; the more effective the governance, the more elaborate the ritual.

sentences.zh: 干戚之舞，非備樂也；

translations.literal: The dance of shields and axes is not complete music;
translations.idiomatic: The martial dances with shields and axes do not constitute complete music.

sentences.zh: 亨孰而祀，非達禮也。

translations.literal: Offering cooked food in sacrifice is not thorough ritual.
translations.idiomatic: Sacrifices of cooked meats do not represent the full scope of ritual.

sentences.zh: 五帝殊時，不相沿樂；

translations.literal: The Five Emperors had different times, did not hand down music to each other;
translations.idiomatic: The Five Emperors lived in different eras and did not perpetuate each other's music.

sentences.zh: 三王異世，不相襲禮。

translations.literal: the Three Kings had different generations, did not copy each other's ritual.
translations.idiomatic: The Three Kings belonged to different ages and did not imitate each other's rituals.

sentences.zh: 樂極則憂，禮粗則偏矣。

translations.literal: When music reaches its extreme it becomes sorrowful, when ritual is crude it becomes one-sided.
translations.idiomatic: Music pushed to excess breeds anxiety; ritual performed carelessly leads to imbalance.

sentences.zh: 及夫敦樂而無憂，禮備而不偏者，其唯大聖乎？

translations.literal: As for deep music without sorrow, complete ritual without bias—who but the great sage could achieve this?
translations.idiomatic: Only the greatest sages can create music so profound it contains no anxiety, ritual so perfect it shows no partiality.

sentences.zh: 天高地下，萬物散殊，而禮制行也；

translations.literal: Heaven is high, earth is low, the ten thousand things are scattered and distinct, and ritual's regulations proceed;
translations.idiomatic: Heaven towers above, earth lies below, all things exist in infinite variety—and ritual provides the ordering principles.

sentences.zh: 流而不息，合同而化，而樂興也。

translations.literal: flowing without cease, uniting and transforming, and music arises.
translations.idiomatic: The ceaseless flow of change, the process of unification and metamorphosis—these give rise to music.

sentences.zh: 春作夏長，仁也；

translations.literal: Spring initiates, summer grows—this is benevolence;
translations.idiomatic: Spring's awakening and summer's flourishing embody benevolence.

sentences.zh: 秋斂冬藏，義也。

translations.literal: autumn harvests, winter stores—this is righteousness.
translations.idiomatic: Autumn's gathering and winter's preservation reflect righteousness.

sentences.zh: 仁近於樂，義近於禮。

translations.literal: Benevolence approaches music, righteousness approaches ritual.
translations.idiomatic: Benevolence finds its expression in music; righteousness in ritual.

sentences.zh: 樂者敦和，率神而從天；

translations.literal: Music is profound harmony, leads the spirits and follows heaven;
translations.idiomatic: Music embodies deep harmony, guides the spirits, and aligns with heaven.

sentences.zh: 禮者辨宜，居鬼而從地。

translations.literal: ritual distinguishes appropriateness, resides with ghosts and follows earth.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual establishes proper distinctions, honors the ancestors, and follows earth's ways.

sentences.zh: 故聖人作樂以應天，作禮以配地。

translations.literal: Therefore sages make music to respond to heaven, make ritual to match earth.
translations.idiomatic: This is why sages create music to resonate with heaven and establish ritual to complement earth.

sentences.zh: 禮樂明備，天地官矣。

translations.literal: When ritual and music are clearly complete, heaven and earth are served.
translations.idiomatic: When ritual and music are fully realized, they properly serve the functions of heaven and earth.

translations.literal: Kings when merit complete make music, when governance settled establish ritual. Merit great then music complete, governance clear then ritual complete. Shield axe dance, not complete music; Cook sacrifice, not reach ritual. Five Emperors different times, not continue music; Three Kings different ages, not imitate ritual. Music extreme then worry, ritual crude then partial. Reach sincere music without worry, ritual complete without partial, its only great sage? Heaven high earth low, ten thousand things scattered different, ritual system carries; Flows without cease, unites contracts transforms, music arises. Spring makes summer grows, benevolence; Autumn gathers winter stores, righteousness. Benevolence close to music, righteousness close to ritual. Music sincere harmony, leads spirits follows heaven; Ritual distinguishes suitable, dwells ghosts follows earth. Thus sages make music to respond heaven, make ritual to match earth. Ritual music clear complete, heaven earth official.

sentences.zh: 天尊地卑，君臣定矣。

translations.literal: Heaven is honored, earth is humble, ruler and minister are established.
translations.idiomatic: Heaven's elevation and earth's humility establish the hierarchy of sovereign and subject.

sentences.zh: 高卑已陳，貴賤位矣。

translations.literal: High and low are already displayed, noble and base positions established.
translations.idiomatic: The gradations of rank are clearly defined; positions of honor and humility are fixed.

sentences.zh: 動靜有常，小大殊矣。

translations.literal: Movement and stillness have regularity, small and great are distinguished.
translations.idiomatic: Activity and rest follow proper patterns; the grand and the modest maintain their distinctions.

sentences.zh: 方以類聚，物以群分，則性命不同矣。

translations.literal: Directions gather by kinds, things divide by groups, then natures and destinies differ.
translations.idiomatic: Similar directions cluster together, like things form groups—and thus individual natures and fates emerge distinct.

sentences.zh: 在天成象，在地成形，如此則禮者天地之別也。

translations.literal: In heaven forms images, on earth forms shapes, in this way ritual is heaven and earth's distinction.
translations.idiomatic: Heaven produces constellations, earth generates forms—thus ritual embodies the ordered distinctions of cosmos.

sentences.zh: 地氣上隮，天氣下降，陰陽相摩，天地相蕩，鼓之以雷霆，奮之以風雨，動之以四時，煖之以日月，而百［物］化興焉，如此則樂者天地之和也。

translations.literal: Earth qi rises upward, heaven qi descends downward, yin and yang rub against each other, heaven and earth collide, drummed by thunder, aroused by wind and rain, moved by the four seasons, warmed by sun and moon, and the hundred things' transformations flourish, in this way music is heaven and earth's harmony.
translations.idiomatic: Earth's vital energy ascends, heaven's energy descends. Yin and yang interact, heaven and earth resonate. Thunder drums, wind and rain stir, seasons cycle, sun and moon warm—and thus all life transforms and flourishes. This is how music embodies the harmony of heaven and earth.

translations.literal: Heaven honored earth humble, ruler minister settled. High low already displayed, noble base positioned. Movement stillness have constant, small large different. Directions by kind gather, things by group divide, then life nature different. In heaven forms images, on earth forms shapes, thus ritual heaven earth's distinction. Earth qi ascends, heaven qi descends, yin yang mutually rub, heaven earth mutually surge, drums with thunder, rouses with wind rain, moves with four seasons, warms with sun moon, hundred things transform arise, thus music heaven earth's harmony.

sentences.zh: 化不時則不生，男女無別則亂登，此天地之情也。

translations.literal: Transformation not in season then does not produce life, male and female without distinction then disorder ascends, this is heaven and earth's inner nature.
translations.idiomatic: When transformation comes out of season, life cannot flourish. When men and women lose their proper distinctions, chaos ensues. Such is the essential nature of heaven and earth.

sentences.zh: 及夫禮樂之極乎天而蟠乎地，行乎陰陽而通乎鬼神，窮高極遠而測深厚，樂著太始而禮居成物。

translations.literal: As for ritual and music reaching heaven and coiling on earth, proceeding through yin and yang and connecting with ghosts and spirits, exhausting height and reaching distance while measuring depth and thickness, music attaches to the great beginning while ritual resides in completed things.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual and music extend to the heavens and encompass the earth, flow through yin and yang, commune with spirits. They probe the highest reaches, fathom vast distances, measure profound depths. Music embodies primordial origins; ritual governs completed forms.

sentences.zh: 著不息者天也，著不動者地也。

translations.literal: That which manifests without ceasing is heaven, that which manifests without moving is earth.
translations.idiomatic: The ever-active principle belongs to heaven; the stable foundation to earth.

sentences.zh: 一動一靜者，天地之閒也。

translations.literal: One movement one stillness is the space between heaven and earth.
translations.idiomatic: The alternation of activity and repose fills the realm between heaven and earth.

sentences.zh: 故聖人曰「禮云樂云」。

translations.literal: Therefore sages say 'Ritual! Music!'
translations.idiomatic: This is why the sages declare: 'Behold ritual! Behold music!'

translations.literal: Transform not timely then not born, male female no distinction then chaos ascends, this heaven earth's feelings. Reach ritual music's extreme heaven coil earth, walk yin yang connect ghosts spirits, exhaust high extreme far measure deep thick, music manifests great beginning ritual dwells completed things. Manifest not cease heaven, manifest not move earth. One move one still, heaven earth's between. Thus sages say 'ritual cloud music cloud'.

sentences.zh: 昔者舜作五弦之琴，以歌南風；

translations.literal: In former times Shun made a five-stringed zither, to sing the Southern Wind;
translations.idiomatic: In ancient days, Shun crafted a five-stringed zither to sing of the Southern Wind.

sentences.zh: 夔始作樂，以賞諸侯。

translations.literal: Kui began making music, to reward the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Kui pioneered musical composition to honor meritorious lords.

sentences.zh: 故天子之為樂也，以賞諸侯之有德者也。

translations.literal: Therefore the Son of Heaven's making music is to reward feudal lords who have virtue.
translations.idiomatic: Thus the emperor creates music to honor those lords who exemplify virtue.

sentences.zh: 德盛而教尊，五穀時孰，然後賞之以樂。

translations.literal: Virtue flourishes and teachings are honored, the five grains ripen in season, then reward them with music.
translations.idiomatic: When virtue prevails and moral instruction commands respect, when crops ripen timely in all seasons—only then bestow the honor of music.

sentences.zh: 故其治民勞者，其舞行級遠；

translations.literal: Therefore for those who govern the people with toil, their dance steps are numerous and far;
translations.idiomatic: Thus, rulers who work their people hard perform dances with many steps covering great distances.

sentences.zh: 其治民佚者，其舞行級短。

translations.literal: those who govern the people with ease, their dance steps are few and near.
translations.idiomatic: Rulers who allow their people leisure perform dances with fewer, closer steps.

sentences.zh: 故觀其舞而知其德，聞其謚而知其行。

translations.literal: Therefore observe their dance and know their virtue, hear their posthumous names and know their conduct.
translations.idiomatic: By watching their dances one can gauge their virtue; by hearing their posthumous titles one can assess their deeds.

sentences.zh: 大章，章之也；

translations.literal: Great Brilliance manifests it;
translations.idiomatic: The Great Brilliance displays virtue.

sentences.zh: 咸池，備也；

translations.literal: Universal Pond completes it;
translations.idiomatic: The Universal Pond achieves completeness.

sentences.zh: 韶，繼也；

translations.literal: Shao continues it;
translations.idiomatic: The Shao perpetuates the tradition.

sentences.zh: 夏，大也；

translations.literal: Xia is great;
translations.idiomatic: The Xia embodies grandeur.

sentences.zh: 殷周之樂盡也。

translations.literal: Yin and Zhou's music exhausts it.
translations.idiomatic: The music of Yin and Zhou represents its culmination.

translations.literal: Former Shun made five string qin, to sing southern wind; Kui first made music, to reward feudal lords. Thus Son of Heaven makes music, to reward feudal lords who have virtue. Virtue flourishing teaching honored, five grains timely ripe, then reward with music. Thus govern people toil, their dance steps grade far; Govern people ease, their dance steps grade short. Thus observe dance know virtue, hear posthumous know conduct. Great Zhang, zhang it; Xian Chi, complete; Shao, continue; Xia, great; Yin Zhou music exhaust.

sentences.zh: 天地之道，寒暑不時則疾，風雨不節則饑。

translations.literal: Heaven and earth's way: cold and heat not in season then illness, wind and rain not moderate then famine.
translations.idiomatic: The natural order demands that cold and heat arrive seasonally, lest disease follow; wind and rain must be measured, lest famine ensue.

sentences.zh: 教者，民之寒暑也，教不時則傷世。

translations.literal: Education is the people's cold and heat, education not in season then harms the age.
translations.idiomatic: Education serves the people like seasonal temperatures—if improperly timed, it harms society.

sentences.zh: 事者，民之風雨也，事不節則無功。

translations.literal: Labor is the people's wind and rain, labor not moderate then no achievement.
translations.idiomatic: Work nourishes the people like seasonal rains—if excessive, it yields no benefit.

sentences.zh: 然則先王之為樂也，以法治也，善則行象德矣。

translations.literal: Thus then the former kings' making music was to govern with law, good then conduct manifests virtue.
translations.idiomatic: Thus the ancient kings created music as a form of governance. When virtuous, their actions embody moral character.

sentences.zh: 夫豢豕為酒，非以為禍也；

translations.literal: Now raising pigs for wine is not to create calamity;
translations.idiomatic: Raising pigs to make wine was never intended to cause harm.

sentences.zh: 而獄訟益煩，則酒之流生禍也。

translations.literal: but lawsuits increasingly troublesome, then wine's indulgence produces calamity.
translations.idiomatic: But when litigation multiplies endlessly, excessive drinking becomes a source of social ills.

sentences.zh: 是故先王因為酒禮，一獻之禮，賓主百拜，終日飲酒而不得醉焉，此先王之所以備酒禍也。

translations.literal: Therefore the former kings established wine ritual, the ritual of one offering, host and guest bow a hundred times, drink wine all day but do not become drunk, this is the former kings' way of preparing against wine calamity.
translations.idiomatic: This is why the ancient kings instituted drinking ceremonies. In the ritual of single libations, host and guest exchange a hundred bows, drinking all day without intoxication—this was their safeguard against the dangers of alcohol.

sentences.zh: 故酒食者，所以合歡也。

translations.literal: Therefore wine and food are to unite happiness.
translations.idiomatic: Thus banquets and wine serve to foster communal joy.

translations.literal: Heaven earth's way, cold heat not timely then illness, wind rain not measure then famine. Teaching, people's cold heat, teaching not timely then harm age. Affairs, people's wind rain, affairs not measure then no merit. Thus then former kings make music, with law governs, good then conduct symbolizes virtue. Raise pigs for wine, not for calamity; But lawsuits increasingly frequent, then wine flow gives birth calamity. Thus former kings because wine ritual, one offering ritual, guest host hundred bows, end day drink wine not get drunk, this former kings prepare wine calamity. Thus wine food, to unite joy.

sentences.zh: 樂者，所以象德也；

translations.literal: Music is to manifest virtue;
translations.idiomatic: Music serves to express moral character.

sentences.zh: 禮者，所以閉淫也。

translations.literal: ritual is to block licentiousness.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual serves to prevent excess and disorder.

sentences.zh: 是故先王有大事，必有禮以哀之；

translations.literal: Therefore the former kings had great matters, certainly had ritual to mourn them;
translations.idiomatic: Thus when the ancient kings faced great crises, they used ritual to express grief.

sentences.zh: 有大福，必有禮以樂之：哀樂之分，皆以禮終。

translations.literal: had great blessings, certainly had ritual to rejoice in them: grief and joy's distinctions, all end with ritual.
translations.idiomatic: When they received great blessings, they used ritual to celebrate. All expressions of sorrow and joy find their proper conclusion in ritual.

translations.literal: Music, to symbolize virtue; Ritual, to close licentious. Thus former kings have great affairs, must have ritual to mourn them; Have great blessing, must have ritual to take joy in it: joy sorrow divisions, all with ritual end.

sentences.zh: 樂也者，施也；

translations.literal: Music is bestowal;
translations.idiomatic: Music represents giving and generosity.

sentences.zh: 禮也者，報也。

translations.literal: ritual is repayment.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual represents reciprocity and response.

sentences.zh: 樂，樂其所自生；

translations.literal: Music takes joy in what gave birth to it;
translations.idiomatic: Music celebrates its own origins.

sentences.zh: 而禮，反其所自始。

translations.literal: while ritual returns to what began it.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual honors the sources from which it springs.

sentences.zh: 樂章德，禮報情反始也。

translations.literal: Music manifests virtue, ritual repays feelings and returns to origins.
translations.idiomatic: Music expresses moral character; ritual reciprocates emotions and honors beginnings.

sentences.zh: 所謂大路者，天子之輿也；

translations.literal: What is called the great chariot is the Son of Heaven's carriage;
translations.idiomatic: The imperial chariot referred to as the 'great road' is the emperor's vehicle.

sentences.zh: 龍旂九旒，天子之旌也；

translations.literal: dragon banner with nine streamers, is the Son of Heaven's standard;
translations.idiomatic: The dragon banner with its nine pendants serves as the emperor's ceremonial flag.

sentences.zh: 青黑緣者，天子之葆龜也；

translations.literal: blue-black bordered one is the Son of Heaven's treasure tortoise;
translations.idiomatic: The one bordered in blue-black is the emperor's precious tortoise-shell talisman.

sentences.zh: 從之以牛羊之群，則所以贈諸侯也。

translations.literal: followed by herds of cattle and sheep, then this is what is bestowed upon the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Accompanied by flocks of cattle and sheep, these serve as imperial gifts to the lords.

translations.literal: Music is giving; Ritual is receiving. Music, takes joy in what gives birth to it; Ritual returns to what begins it. Music displays virtue, ritual repays feeling returns to beginning. What is called great carriage, is the Son of Heaven's chariot; Dragon banner nine tassels, is the Son of Heaven's standard; Blue black edged, is the Son of Heaven's canopy turtle; Followed by herds of cattle sheep, then this is to gift feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 樂也者，情之不可變者也；

translations.literal: Music is that which feelings cannot be changed;
translations.idiomatic: Music embodies emotions that cannot be altered.

sentences.zh: 禮也者，理之不可易者也。

translations.literal: ritual is that which principles cannot be altered.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual embodies principles that cannot be changed.

sentences.zh: 樂統同，禮別異，禮樂之說貫乎人情矣。

translations.literal: Music unifies the same, ritual distinguishes differences, the explanation of ritual and music penetrates human feelings.
translations.idiomatic: Music creates unity, ritual establishes distinctions—together they address the full spectrum of human emotion.

sentences.zh: 窮本知變，樂之情也；

translations.literal: Exhausting the root and knowing change is music's inner nature;
translations.idiomatic: Tracing origins and understanding transformation embodies music's essence.

sentences.zh: 著誠去偽，禮之經也。

translations.literal: manifesting sincerity and removing falsehood is ritual's constant principle.
translations.idiomatic: Emphasizing authenticity and rejecting deception forms ritual's fundamental rule.

sentences.zh: 禮樂順天地之誠，達神明之德，降興上下之神，而凝是精粗之體，領父子君臣之節。

translations.literal: Ritual and music follow heaven and earth's sincerity, reach the spirits' virtue, descend and raise the upper and lower spirits, and solidify this refined and coarse substance, lead the father-son ruler-minister sections.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual and music align with the genuine nature of heaven and earth, attain the virtues of the divine, raise and lower the spirits of hierarchy, unify the refined and the coarse, and guide the bonds between fathers and sons, rulers and ministers.

translations.literal: Music is feelings that cannot be changed; Ritual is principles that cannot be altered. Music unites sameness, ritual distinguishes difference, ritual music's explanation penetrates human feelings. Exhaust root know change, music's feeling; Manifest sincerity remove falsity, ritual's constant. Ritual music follows heaven earth's sincerity, reaches spirits' virtue, descends raises high low spirits, and congeals refined coarse bodies, leads father son ruler minister measures.

sentences.zh: 是故大人舉禮樂，則天地將為昭焉。

translations.literal: Therefore when the great person performs ritual and music, then heaven and earth will make it manifest.
translations.idiomatic: Thus when the noble leader conducts ritual and music, heaven and earth themselves bear witness.

sentences.zh: 天地欣合，陰陽相得，煦嫗覆育萬物，然後草木茂，區萌達，羽翮奮，角觡生，蟄蟲昭穌，羽者嫗伏，毛者孕鬻，胎生者不殰而卵生者不殈，則樂之道歸焉耳。

translations.literal: Heaven and earth joyfully unite, yin and yang mutually obtain, warm and brood over nourish the ten thousand things, then grasses and trees flourish, sprouts and shoots reach, winged ones spread wings, horned ones grow horns, hibernating insects appear and stretch, feathered ones brood and hide, furred ones conceive and nourish, womb-born ones do not miscarry and egg-born ones do not break, then the way of music returns thereto.
translations.idiomatic: When heaven and earth unite in harmony, yin and yang complement each other, and all creation receives nurturing warmth, then vegetation flourishes, new life emerges, birds take flight, beasts grow antlers, hibernating creatures awaken, the feathered brood their young, the furred conceive offspring, and no miscarriages or broken eggs mar the natural order—such is the domain of music's harmony.

translations.literal: Thus great person raises ritual music, then heaven earth will become bright. Heaven earth joyful unite, yin yang mutually obtain, warm nurture cover nourish ten thousand things, then grass trees flourish, regions sprout reach, feathered winged strive, horned tusked born, hibernating insects appear crawl, feathered warm brood, furred pregnant produce, womb born not abort egg born not break, then music's way returns there.

sentences.zh: 樂者，非謂黃鐘大呂弦歌干揚也，樂之末節也，故童者舞之；

translations.literal: Music is not speaking of yellow bell great Lü string songs shield axe dances, these are music's final sections, therefore children dance them;
translations.idiomatic: Music does not consist merely of bells, chimes, stringed instruments, songs, and ceremonial weapons—these are but its superficial elements, fit for children's performances.

sentences.zh: 布筵席，陳樽俎，列籩豆，以升降為禮者，禮之末節也，故有司掌之。

translations.literal: Spreading mats and seats, arranging wine vessels and stands, arranging baskets and bowls, with ascending and descending as ritual—these are ritual's final sections, therefore officials manage them.
translations.idiomatic: Laying out mats and seating, arranging wine vessels and platters, setting out ritual baskets—these formal movements of rising and bowing are merely ritual's outward forms, handled by functionaries.

sentences.zh: 樂師辯乎聲詩，故北面而弦；

translations.literal: Music masters are expert in sounds and poems, therefore face north and play strings;
translations.idiomatic: Music directors master vocal and poetic arts, thus they face north to perform on stringed instruments.

sentences.zh: 宗祝辯乎宗廟之禮，故後尸；
