translations.literal: Ancestral invocators are expert in ancestral temple ritual, therefore come after the impersonator;
translations.idiomatic: Temple officiants master ancestral rites, thus they follow the ritual impersonator.

sentences.zh: 商祝辯乎喪禮，故後主人。

translations.literal: Funeral invocators are expert in mourning ritual, therefore come after the host.
translations.idiomatic: Funeral officiants master bereavement ceremonies, thus they follow the chief mourner.

sentences.zh: 是故德成而上，藝成而下；

translations.literal: Therefore virtue completes and goes up, skill completes and goes down;
translations.idiomatic: Thus moral achievement elevates one; technical proficiency remains subordinate.

sentences.zh: 行成而先，事成而後。

translations.literal: conduct completes and comes first, affairs complete and come after.
translations.idiomatic: Character takes precedence over accomplishments; deeds follow conduct.

sentences.zh: 是故先王有上有下，有先有後，然後可以有制於天下也。

translations.literal: Therefore the former kings had upper and lower, had first and last, then they could have regulation over the world.
translations.idiomatic: Thus the ancient kings established hierarchies and sequences, enabling them to govern the realm effectively.

translations.literal: Music, not meaning yellow bell great lu string song shield axe, music's minor section, thus children dance it; Spread mats seats, arrange zun zu, arrange ban dou, with ascending descending as ritual, ritual's minor section, thus officials manage it. Music master distinguishes sounds poems, thus north facing strings; Ancestral priest distinguishes ancestral temple ritual, thus behind corpse; Funeral priest distinguishes mourning ritual, thus behind master. Thus virtue complete then above, skill complete then below; Conduct complete then first, affairs complete then after. Thus former kings have above below, have first after, then can have system over the world.

sentences.zh: 樂者，聖人之所樂也，而可以善民心。

translations.literal: Music is what sages take pleasure in, and can improve the people's hearts.
translations.idiomatic: Music represents the sages' true delight, and serves to cultivate virtuous minds among the people.

sentences.zh: 其感人深，其風移俗易，故先王著其教焉。

translations.literal: Its influence on people is deep, its style shifts customs easily, therefore the former kings established its teachings.
translations.idiomatic: Its impact on human hearts runs deep; it transforms customs and habits with ease. This is why the ancient kings enshrined its principles in education.

translations.literal: Music is what sages take joy in, and can improve people's hearts. Its moving people deep, its wind shifts customs easy, thus former kings established its teaching.

sentences.zh: 夫人有血氣心知之性，而無哀樂喜怒之常，應感起物而動，然後心術形焉。

translations.literal: Humans have the nature of blood qi and heart knowing, but no constants of sorrow joy happiness anger, responding to stimuli arise from things and move, then the heart's methods take form.
translations.idiomatic: Humans possess vital energy and cognitive faculties, but lack fixed patterns of grief, joy, delight, or anger. Only when stimulated by external things do these emotions manifest and mental processes take shape.

sentences.zh: 是故志微焦衰之音作，而民思憂；

translations.literal: Therefore when sounds of slight anxiety and decline arise, the people think anxiously;
translations.idiomatic: Thus when music expresses subtle anxiety and decay, the people grow pensive and worried.

sentences.zh: 啴緩慢易繁文簡節之音作，而民康樂；

translations.literal: when sounds of expansive leisure and ease, elaborate patterns and simple sections arise, the people are peaceful and happy;
translations.idiomatic: When music conveys expansive ease and leisure, with rich ornamentation and measured rhythms, the people find contentment and joy.

sentences.zh: 粗厲猛起奮末廣賁之音作，而民剛毅；

translations.literal: when sounds of coarseness harshness fierce rising excited ending broad splendor arise, the people are firm and resolute;
translations.idiomatic: When music embodies roughness, severity, explosive energy, and magnificent breadth, the people develop strength and determination.

sentences.zh: 廉直經正莊誠之音作，而民肅敬；

translations.literal: when sounds of uprightness directness classic correctness solemn sincerity arise, the people are solemn and respectful;
translations.idiomatic: When music expresses integrity, directness, traditional propriety, and dignified sincerity, the people become reverent and respectful.

sentences.zh: 寬裕肉好順成和動之音作，而民慈愛；

translations.literal: when sounds of generosity abundance flesh beauty harmonious completion gentle movement arise, the people are benevolent and loving;
translations.idiomatic: When music conveys generosity, abundance, harmony, and gentle progression, the people grow compassionate and affectionate.

sentences.zh: 流辟邪散狄成滌濫之音作，而民淫亂。

translations.literal: when sounds of flowing deviance heretical dispersion barbarian completion washing excess arise, the people are licentious and disorderly.
translations.idiomatic: When music expresses deviance, heresy, dissipation, and excess, the people become immoral and chaotic.

translations.literal: People have blood qi heart knowing nature, but no joy sorrow happiness anger constants, respond to stimulation arise from things and move, then heart methods take form. Thus subtle withered declining sounds made, and people think worry; Smooth slow easy elaborate patterned simple sectioned sounds made, and people peaceful joyful; Coarse fierce violent rising striving end broad flourishing sounds made, and people firm resolute; Pure straight upright correct solemn sincere sounds made, and people solemn respectful; Broad ample fleshy good yielding formed harmonious moving sounds made, and people benevolent loving; Flowing deviant evil scattered foreign formed washed overflowing sounds made, and people licentious chaotic.

sentences.zh: 是故先王本之情性，稽之度數，制之禮義，合生氣之和，道五常之行，使之陽而不散，陰而不密，剛氣不怒，柔氣不懾，四暢交於中而發作於外，皆安其位而不相奪也。

translations.literal: Therefore the former kings based it on emotional nature, examined it by measurements and numbers, regulated it by ritual and righteousness, united the vital energy's harmony, guided the five constants' conduct, made it yang but not dispersed, yin but not dense, firm energy not angry, soft energy not timid, the four flows intermingle in the center and erupt outward, all settle in their positions without usurping each other.
translations.idiomatic: Thus the ancient kings grounded music in human nature, calibrated it to mathematical proportions, shaped it with ritual and moral principles, harmonized vital energies, directed the five virtues. They ensured yang energy flows without dissipation, yin energy concentrates without blockage, firmness never becomes rage, gentleness never succumbs to fear. The four vital currents interact internally and manifest externally, each maintaining its proper domain without conflict.

sentences.zh: 然後立之學等，廣其節奏，省其文采，以繩德厚也。

translations.literal: Then established its academic grades, broadened its rhythms, reduced its ornamentation, to restrain virtue and make it substantial.
translations.idiomatic: They then established educational hierarchies, expanded rhythmic variations, simplified decorative elements, to strengthen moral character and deepen virtue.

sentences.zh: 類小大之稱，比終始之序，以象事行，使親疏貴賤長幼男女之理皆形見於樂：故曰「樂觀其深矣」。

translations.literal: Analogize small and great proportions, compare beginning and end sequences, to symbolize deed conduct, make close-distant noble-base elder-younger male-female principles all visibly appear in music: therefore it is said 'Music observe its profundity.'
translations.idiomatic: They created analogies between small and large, correspondences between beginnings and endings, to symbolize actions and behavior. Thus all principles of intimacy and distance, status and humility, age and gender become manifest in music. Hence the saying: 'The depth of music lies in what it reveals.'

translations.literal: Thus former kings based on feelings nature, examined measurements numbers, formed ritual righteousness, united vital energy harmony, guided five constants conduct, made yang without scattering, yin without dense, firm qi not angry, soft qi not frightened, four flourishing intersect at center and issue at outside, all settle their positions without mutually seizing. Then established study grades, broadened rhythm, simplified patterns colors, to rope virtue thickness. Classify small large proportions, compare end beginning order, to symbolize affairs conduct, make close distant noble base elder younger male female principles all appear in music: thus said 'music observe its deep'.

sentences.zh: 土敝則草木不長，水煩則魚鱉不大，氣衰則生物不育，世亂則禮廢而樂淫。

translations.literal: When soil is exhausted then grasses and trees do not grow, when water is troubled then fish and turtles do not become large, when energy declines then living things are not nurtured, when the age is chaotic then ritual is abandoned and music becomes licentious.
translations.idiomatic: Exhausted soil fails to nourish vegetation; turbulent waters stunt aquatic life; weakened vital energy prevents reproduction. In disordered times, ritual collapses and music descends into excess.

sentences.zh: 是故其聲哀而不莊，樂而不安，慢易以犯節，流湎以忘本。

translations.literal: Therefore its sounds are sorrowful but not dignified, joyful but not peaceful, indolent and easy to violate sections, flowing and drowning to forget origins.
translations.idiomatic: Thus its tones express grief without dignity, pleasure without tranquility, laziness that ignores proper form, indulgence that forgets fundamental principles.

sentences.zh: 廣則容姦。

translations.literal: Broad then accommodates evil.
translations.idiomatic: When expansive, it harbors corruption.

sentences.zh: 狹則思欲，感滌蕩之氣而滅平和之德，是以君子賤之也。

translations.literal: Narrow then arouses desires, senses the cleansing dissipating energy and extinguishes balanced virtue, this is why gentlemen despise it.
translations.idiomatic: When restrictive, it stirs base appetites, absorbs corrupting influences, and destroys balanced character. This is why the noble reject such music.

translations.literal: Soil exhausted then grass trees not grow, water troubled then fish turtles not big, qi declined then living things not nurture, age chaotic then ritual waste and music licentious. Thus its sounds mournful without solemnity, joyful without peace, casual easy to violate sections, flowing drowning to forget root. Broad then contains evil. Narrow then desires, affected by washed wandering qi and extinguish peaceful virtue, thus gentlemen despise it.

sentences.zh: 凡姦聲感人而逆氣應之，逆氣成象而淫樂興焉。

translations.literal: All depraved sounds influence people and perverse energy responds to them, perverse energy forms images and licentious music arises therefrom.
translations.idiomatic: Corrupt sounds affect human hearts, and disruptive energies resonate in response. These energies manifest visibly, giving rise to decadent music.

sentences.zh: 正聲感人而順氣應之，順氣成象而和樂興焉。

translations.literal: Proper sounds influence people and harmonious energy responds to them, harmonious energy forms images and balanced music arises therefrom.
translations.idiomatic: Upright sounds touch human hearts, and beneficial energies resonate in harmony. These energies manifest constructively, giving rise to balanced music.

sentences.zh: 倡和有應，回邪曲直各歸其分，而萬物之理以類相動也。

translations.literal: Call and response have correspondence, curved and straight each return to their shares, and the principles of the ten thousand things move each other by kind.
translations.idiomatic: Leader and followers respond in harmony; crooked and straight each find their proper place. Thus all things in the universe interact according to their natural affinities.

translations.literal: All evil sounds move people and adverse qi respond to them, adverse qi forms images and licentious music arises. Correct sounds move people and yielding qi respond to them, yielding qi forms images and harmonious music arises. Leader harmony have response, returning deviant curved straight each return to their division, and ten thousand things principle with kind mutually move.

sentences.zh: 是故君子反情以和其志，比類以成其行。

translations.literal: Therefore gentlemen reflect on feelings to harmonize their intentions, compare categories to complete their conduct.
translations.idiomatic: Thus the noble person examines their emotions to align their aspirations, and studies patterns to perfect their behavior.

sentences.zh: 姦聲亂色不留聰明，淫樂廢禮不接於心術，惰慢邪辟之氣不設於身體，使耳目鼻口心知百體皆由順正，以行其義。

translations.literal: Depraved sounds and chaotic colors do not remain in intelligence, licentious music abandons ritual does not connect to mental techniques, lazy indolent heretical deviant energies are not established in the body, make ears eyes nose mouth heart knowing hundred limbs all follow upright correctness, to practice their righteousness.
translations.idiomatic: Corrupt sounds and chaotic sights do not cloud clear perception; decadent music and discarded ritual do not corrupt mental discipline. Slothful, heretical, and deviant influences find no place in the body. Thus ears, eyes, nose, mouth, mind, and all faculties follow the path of moral rectitude.

sentences.zh: 然後發以聲音，文以琴瑟，動以干戚，飾以羽旄，從以簫管，奮至德之光，動四氣之和，以著萬物之理。

translations.literal: Then issue with sounds and voices, pattern with zithers and se, move with shields and axes, adorn with feather banners, accompany with flutes and pipes, display supreme virtue's radiance, stir the four energies' harmony, to manifest the ten thousand things' principles.
translations.idiomatic: Then express through vocal music, embellish with zithers and lutes, animate with ceremonial weapons, adorn with feathered banners, accompany with reed pipes. Thus supreme virtue shines forth, the four vital energies harmonize, and the underlying order of all creation becomes manifest.

sentences.zh: 是故清明象天，廣大象地，終始象四時，周旋象風雨；

translations.literal: Therefore clear brightness symbolizes heaven, vastness symbolizes earth, beginning and end symbolize the four seasons, circling symbolizes wind and rain;
translations.idiomatic: Thus clarity represents heaven, magnitude represents earth, cycles represent the seasons, fluid motion represents wind and rain.

sentences.zh: 五色成文而不亂，八風從律而不姦，百度得數而有常；

translations.literal: five colors form patterns without disorder, eight winds follow pitch pipes without deviance, hundred measures obtain numbers and have regularity;
translations.idiomatic: The five colors form coherent designs; the eight winds adhere to musical standards; the hundred regulations follow mathematical principles with perfect consistency.

sentences.zh: 小大相成，終始相生，倡和清濁，代相為經。

translations.literal: small and great mutually complete, beginning and end mutually generate, call and response clear and muddy, alternate as warp threads.
translations.idiomatic: Small and large complement each other; beginnings and endings generate each other. Leader and chorus, pure and resonant tones alternate in perfect harmony.

sentences.zh: 故樂行而倫清，耳目聰明，血氣和平，移風易俗，天下皆寧。

translations.literal: Therefore when music proceeds then human relationships are clear, ears and eyes are intelligent, vital energy is peaceful, customs are shifted and habits changed, the world is all tranquil.
translations.idiomatic: Thus when proper music prevails, social hierarchies become clear, senses sharpen, vital energies balance, customs transform, and universal peace ensues.

sentences.zh: 故曰「樂者樂也」。

translations.literal: Therefore it is said 'Music is joy.'
translations.idiomatic: Hence the saying: 'Music embodies true joy.'

sentences.zh: 君子樂得其道，小人樂得其欲。

translations.literal: Gentlemen take joy in obtaining the Way, petty people take joy in obtaining their desires.
translations.idiomatic: The noble find joy in moral principles; the common seek pleasure in satisfying desires.

sentences.zh: 以道制欲，則樂而不亂；

translations.literal: Using the Way to control desires, then joy without disorder;
translations.idiomatic: When moral principles govern desires, joy remains orderly and pure.

sentences.zh: 以欲忘道，則惑而不樂。

translations.literal: Using desires to forget the Way, then confusion without joy.
translations.idiomatic: When desires eclipse moral principles, confusion replaces true joy.

sentences.zh: 是故君子反情以和其志，廣樂以成其教，樂行而民鄉方，可以觀德矣。

translations.literal: Therefore gentlemen reflect on feelings to harmonize their intentions, broaden music to complete their teaching, music proceeds and the people face the proper direction, then virtue can be observed.
translations.idiomatic: Thus the noble person examines their emotions to align their will, expands musical culture to perfect their teachings. When music prevails and people embrace proper conduct, moral character becomes visible.

translations.literal: Thus gentleman returns to feeling to harmonize will, compares kinds to complete conduct. Evil sounds chaotic colors not stay intelligence, licentious music wastes ritual not connect to heart methods, lazy slow deviant crooked qi not placed in body, make ears eyes nose mouth heart knowing hundred bodies all follow upright correct, to carry out their righteousness. Then issue with sounds, pattern with qin se, move with shield axe, adorn with feather banners, follow with xiao pipes, strive utmost virtue light, move four qi harmony, to manifest ten thousand things principle. Thus clear bright symbolizes heaven, vast symbolizes earth, end beginning symbolizes four seasons, circling symbolizes wind rain; Five colors form pattern without chaos, eight winds follow pitch without evil, hundred measures obtain number have constant; Small large mutually complete, end beginning mutually born, lead harmony clear turbid, alternate mutually as warp. Thus music carries principles clear, ears eyes intelligent, blood qi peaceful, shift customs change habits, world all peaceful. Thus said 'music joy'. Gentleman joy gets way, small person joy gets desires. With way control desires, then joy without chaos; With desires forget way, then confused without joy. Thus gentleman returns to feeling harmonize will, broadens joy completes teaching, music carries people turn to square, can observe virtue.

sentences.zh: 德者，性之端也；

translations.literal: Virtue is the beginning of human nature;
translations.idiomatic: Moral character represents the essence of human nature.

sentences.zh: 樂者，德之華也；

translations.literal: music is virtue's splendor;
translations.idiomatic: Music embodies virtue's flowering beauty.

sentences.zh: 金石絲竹，樂之器也。

translations.literal: metal stone silk bamboo are music's instruments.
translations.idiomatic: Bells, chimes, strings, and reeds serve as music's instruments.

sentences.zh: 詩，言其志也；

translations.literal: Poetry speaks its intention;
translations.idiomatic: Poetry expresses inner aspirations.

sentences.zh: 歌，詠其聲也；

translations.literal: song chants its sound;
translations.idiomatic: Song gives voice to melody.

sentences.zh: 舞，動其容也：三者本乎心，然後樂氣從之。

translations.literal: dance moves its appearance: these three are based in the heart, then the music energy follows them.
translations.idiomatic: Dance animates physical expression. All three—poetry, song, dance—spring from the heart, and musical inspiration follows.

sentences.zh: 是故情深而文明，氣盛而化神，和順積中而英華發外，唯樂不可以為偽。

translations.literal: Therefore feelings deep and culture bright, energy abundant and transforms to spirit, harmony and compliance accumulate within and excellence flowers outward, only music cannot be false.
translations.idiomatic: Thus deep emotions manifest as cultural refinement; abundant vital energy transforms into spiritual power. Harmony and obedience accumulate within, brilliance flowers without. Only music cannot be hypocritical.

translations.literal: Virtue, nature's beginning; Music, virtue's flower; Metal stone silk bamboo, music's instruments. Poem, speaks will; Song, chants sound; Dance, moves appearance: three from heart, then music qi follows. Thus feelings deep civilized bright, qi flourishing transforms divine, harmonious yielding accumulates center brilliant flower issues outside, only music cannot be false.

sentences.zh: 樂者，心之動也；

translations.literal: Music is the heart's movement;
translations.idiomatic: Music represents the heart's response.

sentences.zh: 聲者，樂之象也；

translations.literal: sound is music's image;
translations.idiomatic: Sound provides music's outward form.

sentences.zh: 文采節奏，聲之飾也。

translations.literal: patterned colors and rhythms are sound's adornment.
translations.idiomatic: Melodic patterns and rhythms embellish the sound.

sentences.zh: 君子動其本，樂其象，然後治其飾。

translations.literal: Gentlemen move their root, enjoy its image, then regulate its adornment.
translations.idiomatic: The noble person stirs from inner essence, delights in outward expression, then refines the embellishments.

sentences.zh: 是故先鼓以警戒，三步以見方，再始以著往，復亂以飭歸，奮疾而不拔，（也）極幽而不隱。

translations.literal: Therefore first drum to alert and warn, three steps to show the square, repeat beginning to manifest going forth, return chaos to arrange returning, exert speed without pulling up, reach the profound without hiding.
translations.idiomatic: Thus the initial drumbeat signals attention; three paces establish proper formation. The opening repeats to mark departure; the finale organizes return. Energy surges without interruption; the music penetrates deepest mysteries without obscurity.

sentences.zh: 獨樂其志，不厭其道；

translations.literal: Alone takes joy in his will, does not weary of his way;
translations.idiomatic: He finds satisfaction in his own aspirations, never tires of the proper path.

sentences.zh: 備舉其道，不私其欲。

translations.literal: fully practices his way, does not make private his desires.
translations.idiomatic: He completely embodies moral principles, harbors no selfish desires.

sentences.zh: 是以情見而義立，樂終而德尊；

translations.literal: Therefore feelings appear and righteousness stands, music ends and virtue is honored;
translations.idiomatic: Thus emotions manifest and moral principles establish themselves; when the music concludes, virtue stands exalted.

sentences.zh: 君子以好善，小人以息過：故曰「生民之道，樂為大焉」。

translations.literal: Gentlemen use it to love goodness, petty people use it to rest from transgressions: therefore it is said 'Among the ways of living people, music is the greatest.'
translations.idiomatic: The noble cultivate virtue through it; the common find respite from faults. Hence the saying: 'Among all principles for human life, music holds the highest place.'

translations.literal: Music, heart's movement; Sound, music's image; Patterns colors rhythms, sound's ornament. Gentleman moves root, enjoys image, then governs ornament. Thus first drum to warn guard, three steps to show square, twice begin to manifest going, return chaos to arrange return, rouse quick without pull, extreme dark without hide. Alone joy will, not weary way; Complete raise way, not private desires. Thus feelings appear righteousness established, music ends virtue honored; Gentleman with love good, small person with cease faults: thus said 'born people way, music great'.

sentences.zh: 君子曰：禮樂不可以斯須去身。

translations.literal: Gentlemen say: ritual and music cannot for a moment leave the body.
translations.idiomatic: The wise declare: 'Ritual and music must never depart from one's person, not even for a moment.'

sentences.zh: 致樂以治心，則易直子諒之心油然生矣。

translations.literal: Apply music to regulate the heart, then the heart of simplicity uprightness filial piety sincerity spontaneously arises.
translations.idiomatic: When music cultivates the mind, a heart of natural sincerity, filial devotion, and trustworthiness spontaneously emerges.

sentences.zh: 易直子諒之心生則樂，樂則安，安則久，久則天，天則神。

translations.literal: When the heart of simplicity uprightness filial piety sincerity arises then joy, joy then peace, peace then longevity, longevity then heaven, heaven then spirit.
translations.idiomatic: When such a heart emerges, joy follows; joy brings tranquility; tranquility ensures stability; stability achieves harmony with heaven; harmony with heaven attains spiritual power.

sentences.zh: 天則不言而信，神則不怒而威。

translations.literal: Heaven then without speaking has trust, spirit then without anger has authority.
translations.idiomatic: Harmony with heaven inspires trust without words; spiritual power commands respect without anger.

sentences.zh: 致樂，以治心者也；

translations.literal: Applying music is to regulate the heart;
translations.idiomatic: Music serves to cultivate the inner mind.

sentences.zh: 致禮，以治躬者也。

translations.literal: applying ritual is to regulate the person.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual serves to discipline outward behavior.

sentences.zh: 治躬則莊敬，莊敬則嚴威。

translations.literal: Regulate the person then dignified respect, dignified respect then stern authority.
translations.idiomatic: Self-discipline produces solemn reverence; solemn reverence generates commanding presence.

sentences.zh: 心中斯須不和不樂，而鄙詐之心入之矣；

translations.literal: If the heart for a moment is not harmonious not joyful, then base deceitful heart enters it;
translations.idiomatic: The moment inner harmony and joy falter, base and deceitful thoughts invade the mind.

sentences.zh: 外貌斯須不莊不敬，而慢易之心入之矣。

translations.literal: if outward appearance for a moment is not solemn not respectful, then indolent easy heart enters it.
translations.idiomatic: The moment outward demeanor lacks dignity and respect, lazy and frivolous attitudes take hold.

sentences.zh: 故樂也者，動於內者也；

translations.literal: Therefore music is that which moves from within;
translations.idiomatic: Music originates from inner impulses.

sentences.zh: 禮也者，動於外者也。

translations.literal: ritual is that which moves from without.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual responds to external forms.

sentences.zh: 樂極和，禮極順。

translations.literal: Music reaches its extreme in harmony, ritual reaches its extreme in compliance.
translations.idiomatic: Music achieves perfection through harmony; ritual through proper order.

sentences.zh: 內和而外順，則民瞻其顏色而弗與爭也，望其容貌而民不生易慢焉。

translations.literal: Inner harmony and outer compliance, then the people gaze upon their complexion and do not contend with them, look at their appearance and the people do not give rise to casual disrespect.
translations.idiomatic: When inner peace matches outer propriety, people observe such individuals and refrain from conflict; they behold their bearing and harbor no casual disrespect.

sentences.zh: 德煇動乎內而民莫不承聽，理發乎外而民莫不承順，故曰「知禮樂之道，舉而錯之天下無難矣」。

translations.literal: Virtue's radiance moves within and the people none do not accept and obey, principle manifests outwardly and the people none do not accept and comply, therefore it is said 'Know ritual and music's way, raise and place it throughout the world without difficulty.'
translations.idiomatic: When virtue's inner light stirs, all people heed and obey; when proper order manifests externally, all follow willingly. Hence the saying: 'Master the principles of ritual and music, and governing the world becomes effortless.'

translations.literal: Gentleman says: ritual music cannot moment leave body. Reach music to govern heart, then easy straight filial sincere heart naturally born. Easy straight filial sincere heart born then joy, joy then peaceful, peaceful then long, long then heaven, heaven then divine. Heaven then not speak trustworthy, divine then not angry awe. Reach music, to govern heart; Reach ritual, to govern person. Govern person then solemn respectful, solemn respectful then strict awe. Heart moment not harmonious not joyful, base deceit heart enters; Outside appearance moment not solemn not respectful, lazy easy heart enters. Thus music, moves within; Ritual, moves without. Music extreme harmony, ritual extreme yielding. Inner harmony outer yielding, then people gaze face not contend, look appearance people not born easy lazy. Virtue splendor moves within people none not receive hear, principle issues without people none not receive follow, thus said 'know ritual music way, raise place world no difficulty'.

sentences.zh: 樂也者，動於內者也；

translations.literal: Music is that which moves from within;
translations.idiomatic: Music springs from inner emotions.

sentences.zh: 禮也者，動於外者也。

translations.literal: ritual is that which moves from without.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual conforms to external standards.

sentences.zh: 故禮主其謙，樂主其盈。

translations.literal: Therefore ritual controls its humility, music controls its fullness.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual emphasizes restraint; music embraces abundance.

sentences.zh: 禮謙而進，以進為文；

translations.literal: Ritual is humble and advances, takes advance as its pattern;
translations.idiomatic: Ritual advances modestly, finding beauty in progression.

sentences.zh: 樂盈而反，以反為文。

translations.literal: music is full and returns, takes return as its pattern.
translations.idiomatic: Music reaches fulfillment then returns, finding beauty in cyclical completion.

sentences.zh: 禮謙而不進，則銷；

translations.literal: Ritual humble but does not advance, then dissolves;
translations.idiomatic: Ritual that remains overly deferential without progressing deteriorates.

sentences.zh: 樂盈而不反，則放。

translations.literal: music full but does not return, then dissolute.
translations.idiomatic: Music that overflows without returning to center becomes decadent.

sentences.zh: 故禮有報而樂有反。

translations.literal: Therefore ritual has reciprocity and music has return.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual requires mutual response; music demands cyclical return.

sentences.zh: 禮得其報則樂，樂得其反則安。

translations.literal: Ritual obtains its reciprocity then joy, music obtains its return then peace.
translations.idiomatic: When ritual receives proper response, joy results; when music completes its cycle, tranquility follows.

sentences.zh: 禮之報，樂之反，其義一也。

translations.literal: Ritual's reciprocity, music's return, their meaning is one.
translations.idiomatic: The reciprocity of ritual and the return of music share the same principle.

translations.literal: Music, moves within; Ritual, moves without. Thus ritual masters humility, music masters fullness. Ritual humble advances, with advance as pattern; Music full returns, with return as pattern. Ritual humble not advance, then disappears; Music full not return, then abandons. Thus ritual has repay music has return. Ritual gets repay then joy, music gets return then peaceful. Ritual's repay, music's return, meaning one.

sentences.zh: 夫樂者樂也，人情之所不能免也。

translations.literal: Now music is joy, it is what human feelings cannot avoid.
translations.idiomatic: Music embodies joy itself—an essential aspect of human nature that cannot be escaped.

sentences.zh: 樂必發諸聲音，形於動靜，人道也。

translations.literal: Music must issue from sounds and voices, take form in movement and stillness, this is the human way.
translations.idiomatic: Music must express itself through sound, manifest in motion and rest—this is the essence of human culture.

sentences.zh: 聲音動靜，性術之變，盡於此矣。

translations.literal: Sounds voices movement stillness, nature and technique's changes, are exhausted in this.
translations.idiomatic: All variations of sound, all techniques of motion and stillness, find their complete expression here.

sentences.zh: 故人不能無樂，樂不能無形。

translations.literal: Therefore humans cannot be without music, music cannot be without form.
translations.idiomatic: Thus humans cannot exist without music, nor music without outward expression.

sentences.zh: 形而不為道，不能無亂。

translations.literal: Form but not guided by the Way, cannot avoid disorder.
translations.idiomatic: When expression lacks moral direction, chaos inevitably follows.

sentences.zh: 先王惡其亂，故制雅頌之聲以道之，使其聲足以樂而不流，使其文足以綸而不息，使其曲直繁省廉肉節奏，足以感動人之善心而已矣，不使放心邪氣得接焉，是先王立樂之方也。

translations.literal: The former kings hated its disorder, therefore established the ya and song sounds to guide it, made their sound sufficient to bring joy without flowing away, their pattern sufficient to weave without weariness, their curved straight elaborate simple upright fleshy rhythms sufficient to move people's good hearts only, not allowing unrestrained evil energies to connect with it, this is the former kings' method of establishing music.
translations.idiomatic: The ancient kings despised such chaos, so they created the refined music of the Odes and Hymns to provide proper guidance. They ensured the melodies brought joy without excess, the compositions wove complex patterns without tedium, the rhythms—curved and straight, elaborate and simple, firm and supple—stirred virtuous hearts alone, barring all contact with wayward and corrupt influences. This was their method for establishing true music.

sentences.zh: 是故樂在宗廟之中，君臣上下同聽之，則莫不和敬；

translations.literal: Therefore music in ancestral temples, ruler and ministers high and low together hear it, then none are not harmonious and respectful;
translations.idiomatic: Thus when music fills the ancestral halls and sovereign, ministers, superiors, and inferiors listen together, all achieve harmony and reverence.

sentences.zh: 在族長鄉里之中，長幼同聽之，則莫不和順；

translations.literal: in clan elders village neighborhoods, elder and younger together hear it, then none are not harmonious and compliant;
translations.idiomatic: When music resonates in clan gatherings and village communities, elders and youth listening together, all achieve harmony and proper conduct.

sentences.zh: 在閨門之內，父子兄弟同聽之，則莫不和親。

translations.literal: within the inner chambers, fathers and sons brothers together hear it, then none are not harmonious and close.
translations.idiomatic: When music fills the family quarters and fathers, sons, and brothers listen together, all achieve harmony and familial closeness.

sentences.zh: 故樂者，審一以定和，比物以飾節，節奏合以成文，所以合和父子君臣，附親萬民也，是先王立樂之方也。

translations.literal: Therefore music examines unity to establish harmony, compares things to adorn sections, rhythms unite to form patterns, thus uniting and harmonizing fathers-sons rulers-ministers, attaching and bringing close the myriad people, this is the former kings' method of establishing music.
translations.idiomatic: Thus music examines unity to establish harmony, compares phenomena to embellish its divisions, unites rhythms to form coherent patterns. This unites fathers and sons, rulers and ministers in harmony, draws the people close in affection. Such is the ancient kings' method for establishing music.

sentences.zh: 故聽其雅頌之聲，志意得廣焉；

translations.literal: Therefore listening to the ya and song sounds, intentions and thoughts become broad;
translations.idiomatic: Thus, listening to the refined music of the Odes expands one's aspirations and thoughts.

sentences.zh: 執其干戚，習其俯仰詘信，容貌得莊焉；

translations.literal: holding their shields and axes, practicing their bowing and rising bending and straightening, appearance and manner become dignified;
translations.idiomatic: Gripping shields and axes, practicing the movements of bowing, rising, bending, and extending—the bearing becomes dignified.

sentences.zh: 行其綴兆，要其節奏，行列得正焉，進退得齊焉。

translations.literal: performing their patterned positions, grasping their rhythms, ranks and files become correct, advancing and retreating become orderly.
translations.idiomatic: Following the choreographed positions and mastering the rhythms—formations align properly, advances and retreats become coordinated.

sentences.zh: 故樂者天地之齊，中和之紀，人情之所不能免也。

translations.literal: Therefore music is heaven and earth's alignment, balanced harmony's guideline, that which human feelings cannot avoid.
translations.idiomatic: Thus music embodies the alignment of heaven and earth, serves as the standard for balanced harmony, and represents what human emotions cannot escape.

translations.literal: Music joy, human feelings cannot avoid. Music must issue from sounds, form in movement stillness, human way. Sounds movement stillness, nature method change, exhaust here. Thus people cannot lack music, music cannot lack form. Form without following way, cannot lack chaos. Former kings hated its chaos, thus formed ya song sounds to guide it, make its sounds sufficient for joy without flowing, make its patterns sufficient to bind without tiring, make its curved straight elaborate simple pure fleshy rhythms, sufficient to move people's good hearts only, not let wandering evil qi connect, this is former kings establishing music's method. Thus music in ancestral temple midst, ruler minister high low together hear it, then none not harmonious respectful; In clan elder village hamlet midst, elder younger together hear it, then none not harmonious yielding; In inner chambers within, father son brothers together hear it, then none not harmonious close. Thus music examines one to settle harmony, compares things to adorn sections, rhythms combine to form patterns, thus unites harmonizes father son ruler minister, attaches close ten thousand people, this is former kings establishing music's method. Thus hear its ya song sounds, will intent gets broad; Grasp its shield axe, practice its bow rise bend stretch, appearance gets solemn; Carry its connected ranks, grasp its rhythms, rows columns get correct, advance retreat get even. Thus music is heaven earth's equal, central harmony's record, human feelings cannot avoid.

sentences.zh: 夫樂者，先王之所以飾喜也；

translations.literal: Now music is the former kings' way of adorning joy;
translations.idiomatic: Music serves as the ancient kings' means of expressing and enhancing joy.

sentences.zh: 軍旅鈇鉞者，先王之所以飾怒也。

translations.literal: military campaigns and axes are the former kings' way of adorning anger.
translations.idiomatic: Military expeditions and executions serve as the ancient kings' means of expressing righteous anger.

sentences.zh: 故先王之喜怒皆得其齊矣。

translations.literal: Therefore the former kings' joy and anger all obtained their proper measure.
translations.idiomatic: Thus the ancient kings' expressions of joy and anger were always appropriately measured.

sentences.zh: 喜則天下和之，怒則暴亂者畏之。

translations.literal: When joyful then the world harmonizes with it, when angry then the violent and disorderly fear it.
translations.idiomatic: When they express joy, the world unites in harmony; when they express anger, the violent tremble in fear.

sentences.zh: 先王之道禮樂可謂盛矣。

translations.literal: The former kings' way of ritual and music can be called flourishing.
translations.idiomatic: The ancient kings' system of ritual and music can truly be called magnificent.

translations.literal: Music is former kings' way to adorn joy; Military campaigns axes hatchets is former kings' way to adorn anger. Thus former kings' joy anger all got their equal. Joy then world harmonizes it, anger then violent chaotic fear it. Former kings' way ritual music can be called flourishing.

sentences.zh: 魏文侯問於子夏曰：「吾端冕而聽古樂則唯恐臥，聽鄭衛之音則不知倦。

translations.literal: Marquis Wen of Wei asked Zi Xia saying: 'I put on formal robes and listen to ancient music then only fear falling asleep, listen to Zheng and Wei sounds then do not know weariness.
translations.idiomatic: Marquis Wen of Wei asked Zi Xia: 'When I don formal robes to listen to ancient music, I can barely stay awake. But when I hear the tunes of Zheng and Wei, I never grow tired.'

sentences.zh: 敢問古樂之如彼，何也？

translations.literal: Dare ask why ancient music is like that?
translations.idiomatic: May I ask why ancient music has this effect?

sentences.zh: 新樂之如此，何也？」

translations.literal: why new music is like this?'
translations.idiomatic: And why modern music has the opposite effect?'

translations.literal: Wei Wen Hou asked Zi Xia saying: 'I properly capped robed hear ancient music then only fear sleeping, hear Zheng Wei sounds then not know tiredness. Dare ask ancient music like that, why? New music like this, why?'

sentences.zh: 子夏答曰：「今夫古樂，進旅而退旅，和正以廣，弦匏笙簧合守拊鼓，始奏以文，止亂以武，治亂以相，訊疾以雅。

translations.literal: Zi Xia answered saying: 'Now as for ancient music, advancing groups and retreating groups, harmonious and correct to broaden, strings gourds reed pipes unite guarding the beating drum, beginning performance with refinement, stopping disorder with martial force, governing disorder with assistance, speeding up with proper music.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xia replied: 'Ancient music features advancing and retreating formations in perfect coordination, harmonious and correct in its expansive scope. Strings, gourds, reeds, and pipes unite around the conductor's drum. Performances begin with refinement, quell disorder with martial force, govern chaos through mutual support, and accelerate with proper melodies.'

sentences.zh: 君子於是語，於是道古，修身及家，平均天下：此古樂之發也。

translations.literal: Gentlemen thereby converse, thereby discuss antiquity, cultivate self and reach family, balance the world: this is ancient music's arousal.
translations.idiomatic: The noble person engages in discourse, discusses ancient ways, cultivates character and extends to family, brings equity to the world. Such is the inspiration of ancient music.

sentences.zh: 今夫新樂，進俯退俯，姦聲以淫，溺而不止，及優侏儒，獶雜子女，不知父子。

translations.literal: Now as for new music, advancing bowing retreating bowing, depraved sounds to licentiousness, drowning without stopping, reaching actors dwarfs, lewd mixing boys and girls, not knowing father and son.
translations.idiomatic: Modern music features performers bowing obsequiously, its depraved sounds promoting licentiousness, indulging endlessly without restraint. It includes actors and dwarfs, lewdly mixing young men and women, obliterating all sense of familial propriety.

sentences.zh: 樂終不可以語，不可以道古：此新樂之發也。

translations.literal: Music ends cannot converse, cannot discuss antiquity: this is new music's arousal.
translations.idiomatic: After such music ends, one cannot engage in meaningful discourse or discuss ancient teachings. Such is the debasing effect of modern music.

sentences.zh: 今君之所問者樂也，所好者音也。

translations.literal: Now what Your Lordship asks about is music, what you like is sound.
translations.idiomatic: What Your Lordship inquires about is true music; what you enjoy is merely sound.

sentences.zh: 夫樂之與音，相近而不同。」

translations.literal: Now music and sound are close but different.'
translations.idiomatic: Music and mere sound appear similar but are fundamentally different.'

Gentleman thus discusses, thus explains ancient, cultivates self reaches family, evens world: this ancient music's expression. Now new music, advance bow retreat bow, evil sounds with licentious, drown without stop, reach actors dwarfs, mingle mixed sons daughters, not know father son. Music end cannot discuss, cannot explain ancient: this new music's expression. Now lord's asked is music, what likes is sound. Music and sound, close but different.'

sentences.zh: 文侯曰：「敢問如何？」

translations.literal: Marquis Wen said: 'Dare ask how so?'
translations.idiomatic: Marquis Wen asked: 'May I ask for clarification?'

translations.literal: Wen Hou said: 'Dare ask how?'

sentences.zh: 子夏答曰：「夫古者天地順而四時當，民有德而五穀昌，疾疢不作而無祅祥，此之謂大當。

translations.literal: Zi Xia answered saying: 'In ancient times heaven and earth followed order and four seasons were appropriate, people had virtue and five grains prospered, illnesses did not arise and there were no ill omens, this is called great appropriateness.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xia replied: 'In ancient times, heaven and earth operated in harmony, the seasons arrived punctually, people cultivated virtue, the five grains flourished abundantly, illnesses never appeared, and inauspicious omens stayed away. This represents perfect cosmic alignment.'

sentences.zh: 然後聖人作為父子君臣以為之紀綱，紀綱既正，天下大定，天下大定，然後正六律，和五聲，弦歌詩頌，此之謂德音，德音之謂樂。

translations.literal: Then sages made father-son ruler-minister as its guiding principles, guiding principles already correct, world greatly settled, world greatly settled, then corrected six pitch pipes, harmonized five tones, string songs poem hymns, this called virtue sound, virtue sound called music.
translations.idiomatic: Only then did sages establish the relationships of fathers and sons, rulers and ministers as governing principles. With these principles established, the world achieved great stability. With stability secured, they standardized the six pitch pipes, harmonized the five tones, created songs with strings and poems with hymns. This is called virtuous sound; virtuous sound is called music.

sentences.zh: 《詩》曰：『莫其德音，其德克明，克明克類，克長克君。

translations.literal: The Poetry says: 'None match his virtuous sound, his virtue can illuminate, can illuminate can categorize, can lead can rule.
translations.idiomatic: As the Book of Poetry states: 'None can match his virtuous music. His virtue brings illumination, brings proper classification, brings leadership, brings sovereignty.'

sentences.zh: 王此大邦，克順克俾。

translations.literal: Ruling this great state, can comply can aid.
translations.idiomatic: 'Ruling this great domain, he achieves harmony, achieves assistance.'

sentences.zh: 俾於文王，其德靡悔。

translations.literal: Aiding King Wen, his virtue without regret.
translations.idiomatic: 'Aiding King Wen, his virtue knows no regret.'

sentences.zh: 既受帝祉，施于孫子。』

translations.literal: Already received imperial blessings, extended to descendants.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Having received heavenly favor, he extends it to his descendants.'

sentences.zh: 此之謂也。

translations.literal: This is what it means.
translations.idiomatic: This expresses the concept perfectly.

sentences.zh: 今君之所好者，其溺音與？」

translations.idiomatic: What Your Lordship enjoys—is it not the kind of music that drowns the spirit?'

sentences.zh: 文侯曰：「敢問溺音者何從出也？」

translations.literal: Marquis Wen said: 'Dare ask where drowning sound comes from?'
translations.idiomatic: Marquis Wen asked: 'May I ask from where this drowning music originates?'

translations.literal: Wen Hou said: 'Dare ask drown sound from where come?'

sentences.zh: 子夏答曰：「鄭音好濫淫志，宋音燕女溺志，衛音趣數煩志，齊音驁辟驕志，四者皆淫於色而害於德，是以祭祀不用也。

translations.literal: Zi Xia answered saying: 'Zheng sounds like excess licentious will, Song sounds banquet women drown will, Wei sounds hurried numerous annoy will, Qi sounds arrogant deviant arrogant will, these four all licentious in color and harmful to virtue, therefore sacrifices do not use them.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xia replied: 'The music of Zheng indulges in excess and corrupts the will; Song music, with its banquet songs for women, drowns the spirit; Wei music, with its hurried complexity, irritates the mind; Qi music, with its arrogant deviance, inflates the ego. All four indulge sensuality and damage virtue, which is why they are forbidden in sacrificial ceremonies.'

sentences.zh: 《詩》曰：『肅雍和鳴，先祖是聽。』

translations.literal: The Poetry says: 'Reverent harmonious harmonious call, ancestors thereby listen.'
translations.idiomatic: As the Book of Poetry declares: 'Reverent and harmonious sounds call out, and the ancestors listen.'

sentences.zh: 夫肅肅，敬也；

translations.literal: Now reverent reverent is respect;
translations.idiomatic: The term 'reverent' means respectful.

sentences.zh: 雍雍，和也。

translations.literal: harmonious harmonious is harmony.
translations.idiomatic: The term 'harmonious' means balanced concord.

sentences.zh: 夫敬以和，何事不行？

translations.literal: Now respect with harmony, what affair cannot proceed?
translations.idiomatic: When respect combines with harmony, what undertaking cannot succeed?

sentences.zh: 為人君者，謹其所好惡而已矣。

translations.literal: For one who is ruler, be careful of what he likes and dislikes only.
translations.idiomatic: For a sovereign, the key lies simply in being careful about what one approves and rejects.

sentences.zh: 君好之則臣為之，上行之則民從之。

translations.literal: Ruler likes it then ministers do it, superiors practice it then people follow it.
translations.idiomatic: What the ruler enjoys, ministers will emulate; what superiors practice, the people will follow.

sentences.zh: 《詩》曰：『誘民孔易』，此之謂也。

translations.literal: The Poetry says: 'Leading people very easy', this is what it means.
translations.idiomatic: As the Book of Poetry says: 'It is exceedingly easy to lead the people.' This expresses the principle perfectly.

sentences.zh: 然後聖人作為鞉鼓椌楬壎篪，此六者，德音之音也。

translations.literal: Then sages made frame drum small drum scraper clappers xun pipes, these six are virtuous sound's sounds.
translations.idiomatic: Then sages created the frame drum, small drum, scraper, clappers, xun flute, and panpipes—these six constitute the sounds of virtuous music.

sentences.zh: 然後鐘磬竽瑟以和之，干戚旄狄以舞之。

translations.literal: Then bells stone chimes mouth organs zithers to harmonize them, shields axes yak tails pheasant feathers to dance with them.
translations.idiomatic: Then bells and chimes, mouth organs and zithers provide harmony, while shields, axes, yak tails, and pheasant feathers accompany the dance.

sentences.zh: 此所以祭先王之廟也，所以獻醻酳酢也，所以官序貴賤各得其宜也，此所以示後世有尊卑長幼序也。

translations.literal: This is what sacrifices to former kings' temples, what offers toasts libations responses, what ranks nobles and base each obtain their suitability, this is what shows later generations have senior-junior elder-younger order.
translations.idiomatic: This serves to honor the ancestral temples of former kings, to present toasts and libations with proper responses, to establish hierarchies where nobles and commoners each find their proper place. This demonstrates to future generations the proper order of status and age.

sentences.zh: 鐘聲鏗，鏗以立號，號以立橫，橫以立武。

translations.literal: Bell sound clang, clang to establish designation, designation to establish horizontal, horizontal to establish martial.
translations.idiomatic: The bell's resonant clang establishes signals; signals establish formations; formations establish martial prowess.

sentences.zh: 君子聽鐘聲則思武臣。

translations.literal: Gentleman hears bell sound then thinks of martial ministers.
translations.idiomatic: When the noble person hears the bell, he thinks of brave warriors and loyal ministers.

sentences.zh: 石聲硁，硁以立別，別以致死。

translations.literal: Stone sound ting, ting to establish distinction, distinction to bring death.
translations.idiomatic: The chime's clear ting establishes boundaries; boundaries inspire willingness to die for duty.

sentences.zh: 君子聽磬聲則思死封疆之臣。

translations.literal: Gentleman hears chime sound then thinks of die for borders ministers.
translations.idiomatic: When the noble person hears the chime, he thinks of ministers who would die defending the frontiers.

sentences.zh: 絲聲哀，哀以立廉，廉以立志。

translations.literal: Silk sound mournful, mournful to establish integrity, integrity to establish will.
translations.idiomatic: The strings' mournful tone establishes uprightness; uprightness establishes firm resolve.

sentences.zh: 君子聽琴瑟之聲則思志義之臣。

translations.literal: Gentleman hears zither se sounds then thinks of will righteousness ministers.
translations.idiomatic: When the noble person hears zithers and lutes, he thinks of ministers devoted to principle and righteousness.

sentences.zh: 竹聲濫，濫以立會，會以聚眾。

translations.literal: Bamboo sound diffuse, diffuse to establish assembly, assembly to gather multitude.
translations.idiomatic: The reeds' spreading sound establishes gatherings; gatherings assemble the multitude.

sentences.zh: 君子聽竽笙簫管之聲則思畜聚之臣。

translations.literal: Gentleman hears mouth organ reed flute pipe sounds then thinks of store gather ministers.
translations.idiomatic: When the noble person hears mouth organs, reeds, flutes, and pipes, he thinks of ministers skilled at gathering and managing resources.

sentences.zh: 鼓鼙之聲讙，讙以立動，動以進眾。

translations.literal: Drum tambourine sounds clamor, clamor to establish movement, movement to advance multitude.
translations.idiomatic: The drums and tambours' clamorous sound establishes momentum; momentum advances the multitude.

sentences.zh: 君子聽鼓鼙之聲則思將帥之臣。

translations.literal: When the noble person hears the sound of drums and tambours, he thinks of generals and commanders.
translations.idiomatic: The noble person, hearing drums and tambours, recalls capable generals and military leaders.

sentences.zh: 君子之聽音，非聽其鏗鎗而已也，彼亦有所合之也。」

translations.literal: The noble person's listening to music is not just listening to its clang clang only, it also has something it unites with.'
translations.idiomatic: The noble person does not merely hear the musical sounds; the music resonates with and evokes deeper associations.'

translations.idiomatic: Bin Moujia was seated in attendance with Confucius. When their conversation turned to music, Confucius asked: 'Why does the Wu dance maintain such a prolonged state of readiness and caution?'

translations.idiomatic: 'Why the extended sighing and unrestrained flowing movements?'

translations.literal: 'Long sigh, licentious liquid, why?'

sentences.zh: 答曰：「恐不逮事也。」

translations.literal: 'Flourishing stamping fierce already early, why?'
translations.idiomatic: 'Why does the energetic stamping and fierce advance begin so soon?'

translations.literal: 'Raise wave tread fierce already early, why?'

translations.literal: Answered saying: 'Catching up with timely affairs.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'It represents seizing the critical moment.'

translations.idiomatic: If the court musicians hadn't corrupted it, King Wu's martial spirit would be clearly preserved.'

translations.literal: Answered saying: 'Officials lost their transmission. If not officials lost their transmission, then Wu Wang's will wasted.'

sentences.zh: 子曰：「唯丘之聞諸萇弘，亦若吾子之言是也。」

translations.literal: The Master said: 'Only I have heard from Chang Hong, also like my son says.'
translations.idiomatic: Confucius remarked: 'I have heard similar views from Master Chang Hong. Your explanation is correct.'

translations.literal: Zi said: 'Only Qiu heard from Chang Hong, also like my son's words correct.'

sentences.zh: 賓牟賈起，免席而請曰：「夫武之備戒之已久，則既聞命矣。

translations.literal: Bin Moujia rose, left his seat and requested: 'The Wu's preparation warning already long, then already heard the command.'
translations.idiomatic: Bin Moujia stood up, left his mat, and earnestly asked: 'I understand the prolonged readiness in the Wu dance represents caution.'

sentences.zh: 敢問遲之遲而又久，何也？」

translations.literal: Dare ask delay's delay and moreover long, why?'
translations.idiomatic: 'But may I ask why the delay is so prolonged and extended?'

translations.literal: Bin Mu Jia rose, left seat and asked saying: 'Wu preparation guard already long, then already heard command. Dare ask slow's slow and moreover long, why?'

sentences.zh: 子曰：「居，吾語汝。

translations.literal: The Master said: 'Sit, I will tell you.'
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'Be seated. Let me explain this to you.'

sentences.zh: 夫樂者，象成者也。

translations.literal: Now music is that which symbolizes completion.
translations.idiomatic: Music represents the achievement of great accomplishments.

sentences.zh: 總干而山立，武王之事也；

translations.literal: Gathering shields and standing like mountains, King Wu's affair;
translations.idiomatic: The gathering of shields and mountain-like stance represents King Wu's conquest.

sentences.zh: 發揚蹈厲，太公之志也；

translations.literal: flourishing stamping fierce, Duke of Zhou's will;
translations.idiomatic: The energetic flourishing and fierce stamping embodies the Duke of Zhou's martial spirit.

sentences.zh: 武亂皆坐，周召之治也。

translations.literal: Wu disorder all sit, Zhou Zhao's governance.
translations.idiomatic: The settling of martial chaos into seated order represents the governance of the Dukes of Zhou and Zhao.

sentences.zh: 且夫武，始而北出，再成而滅商，三成而南，四成而南國是疆，五成而分陜，周公左，召公右，六成復綴，以崇天子，夾振之而四伐，盛（振）威於中國也。

translations.literal: Moreover the Wu, beginning then north exit, second completion then extinguish Shang, third completion then south, fourth completion then southern states are strengthened, fifth completion then divide Xia, Duke of Zhou left, Duke of Zhao right, sixth completion return connect, to honor the Son of Heaven, flank shake it and four attacks, flourish authority in central states.
translations.idiomatic: The Wu dance begins with the northern advance, achieves the destruction of Shang in the second section, turns southward in the third, strengthens the southern domains in the fourth, divides the Xia territory in the fifth with the Duke of Zhou on the left and Duke of Zhao on the right, reunites in the sixth section to exalt the Son of Heaven, flanks him with fourfold attacks, and displays supreme authority throughout the central realm.

sentences.zh: 分夾而進，事蚤濟也。

translations.literal: Dividing flanking and advancing, affairs early completed.
translations.idiomatic: The divided flanking advance represents the swift accomplishment of the mission.

sentences.zh: 久立於綴，以待諸侯之至也。

translations.literal: Long standing at the connection, to wait for the feudal lords' arrival.
translations.idiomatic: The prolonged standing in formation awaits the arrival of the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 且夫女獨未聞牧野之語乎？

translations.literal: Moreover you alone have not heard the Muye speech?
translations.idiomatic: Have you not heard the story of the Battle of Muye?

sentences.zh: 武王克殷反商，未及下車，而封黃帝之後於薊，封帝堯之後於祝，封帝舜之後於陳；

translations.literal: King Wu conquered Yin returned to Shang, not yet alighting from chariot, then enfeoffed Yellow Emperor's descendants at Ji, enfeoffed Emperor Yao's descendants at Zhu, enfeoffed Emperor Shun's descendants at Chen;
translations.idiomatic: King Wu conquered the Yin and returned to the Shang capital. Before even dismounting from his chariot, he enfeoffed the descendants of the Yellow Emperor at Ji, Emperor Yao at Zhu, and Emperor Shun at Chen.

sentences.zh: 下車而封夏后氏之後於杞，封殷之後於宋，封王子比干之墓，釋箕子之囚，使之行商容而復其位。

translations.literal: Alighting from chariot then enfeoffed Xia Hou Shi's descendants at Qi, enfeoffed Yin's descendants at Song, honored Prince Bigan's tomb, released Jizi's imprisonment, made him perform Shang Rong and restore his position.
translations.idiomatic: After dismounting, he enfeoffed the Xia dynasty descendants at Qi and the Yin descendants at Song. He honored Prince Bigan's tomb, released Jizi from prison, and restored him to his position with the rites of Shang Rong.

sentences.zh: 庶民弛政，庶士倍祿。

translations.literal: Common people relaxed administration, various scholars doubled salary.
translations.idiomatic: The common people were relieved of corvée labor; officials received double salaries.

sentences.zh: 濟河而西，馬散華山之陽而弗復乘；

translations.literal: Crossed Yellow River and west, horses scattered Mount Hua's southern slope and not again ridden;
translations.idiomatic: After crossing the Yellow River westward, the horses were released on the southern slopes of Mount Hua, never to be ridden again.

sentences.zh: 牛散桃林之野而不復服；

translations.literal: oxen scattered Peach Grove wilderness and not again yoked;
translations.idiomatic: The oxen were set free in the Peach Grove wilderness, never to be yoked again.

sentences.zh: 車甲弢而藏之府庫而弗復用；

translations.literal: chariots armor covered and stored in treasuries and not again used;
translations.idiomatic: The chariots and armor were covered and stored in warehouses, never to be used again.

sentences.zh: 倒載干戈，苞之以虎皮；

translations.literal: inverted loaded shields spears, wrapped with tiger skins;
translations.idiomatic: Weapons were carried inverted and wrapped in tiger skins.

sentences.zh: 將率之士，使為諸侯，名之曰『建櫜』：然後天下知武王之不復用兵也。

translations.literal: Generals and officers, made into feudal lords, named it 'establishing quivers': then world knew King Wu would not again use troops.
translations.idiomatic: Military leaders were made feudal lords in a ceremony called 'Establishing the Quivers'—thus the world knew King Wu would never wage war again.

sentences.zh: 散軍而郊射，左射貍首，右射騶虞，而貫革之射息也；

translations.literal: Disbanded army and suburban archery, left shot Fox Head, right shot Zouyu, and armor-piercing archery ceased;
translations.idiomatic: The army was disbanded and suburban archery contests held, with the left side shooting at Fox Head targets and the right at Zouyu, ending the days of armor-piercing warfare.

sentences.zh: 裨冕搢笏，而虎賁之士稅劍也；

translations.literal: court robes inserted tablets, and tiger warriors sheathed swords;
translations.idiomatic: Court robes were worn with tablets tucked in sashes; the elite guards sheathed their swords.

sentences.zh: 祀乎明堂，而民知孝；

translations.literal: sacrificed at Bright Hall, and people knew filial piety;
translations.idiomatic: Sacrifices at the Hall of Light taught the people filial devotion.

sentences.zh: 朝覲，然後諸侯知所以臣；

translations.literal: court audiences, then feudal lords knew how to be ministers;
translations.idiomatic: Court audiences taught the feudal lords the proper conduct of vassals.

sentences.zh: 耕藉，然後諸侯知所以敬：五者天下之大教也。

translations.literal: plowing ceremony, then feudal lords knew how to respect: five these world's great teachings.
translations.idiomatic: The royal plowing ceremony taught feudal lords reverence. These five practices constitute the world's greatest educational principles.

sentences.zh: 食三老五更於太學，天子袒而割牲，執醬而饋，執爵而酳，冕而總干，所以教諸侯之悌也。

translations.literal: Fed three elders five veterans at Grand Academy, Son of Heaven bared arms and cut sacrificial animal, held sauce and fed, held goblet and offered, crowned and grasped shield, thus taught feudal lords' brotherly respect.
translations.idiomatic: At the Grand Academy, the emperor hosted three elders and five veterans. He bared his arms to carve the sacrificial meat, presented sauce to feed them, offered wine from his goblet, and stood crowned while holding a shield. This taught feudal lords the virtue of fraternal respect.

sentences.zh: 若此，則周道四達，禮樂交通，則夫武之遲久，不亦宜乎？」

translations.literal: Like this, then Zhou way four reaches, ritual music intercommunicates, then the Wu's delay long, not also appropriate?'
translations.idiomatic: In this way, the Zhou way permeated everywhere, ritual and music flowed freely. Was it not entirely appropriate that the Wu dance should be so prolonged and deliberate?'
